original: rgyas dang zhes bya ba ni rgya cher 'khor lo drug po rnams so //
analyzed: rgyas dang zhes bya ba ni rgya cher 'khor lo drug po rnams so //
translated: Extensive means the six wheels are extensive.

original: slar yang bsdus pa ni zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo drug po bsdus pas kyang 'khor lo bzhi dang yang dag par sbyor ba ni ;
analyzed: slar yang bsdus pa ni zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo drug po bsdus pas kyang 'khor lo bzhi dang yang dag par sbyor ba ni ;
translated: Again, the concise means the four wheels are perfectly applied by the concise six wheels.

original: sprul pa dang / chos dang / longs spyod dang bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: sprul pa dang / chos dang / longs spyod dang bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The essence of the emanation, dharma, enjoyment, and great bliss wheels

original: me'i 'khor lo ni bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i nang du 'dus so //
analyzed: me'i 'khor lo ni bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i nang du 'dus so //
translated: The fire wheel is included in the great bliss wheel.

original: rtsa rnams brgyad dang nyi shu lhag / ces bya ba ni 'khor lo bzhi po rnams ni drug cu rtsa bzhi dang / brgyad dang / bcu drug dang / sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi grangs kyis so //
analyzed: rtsa rnams brgyad dang nyi shu lhag / ces bya ba ni 'khor lo bzhi po rnams ni drug cu rtsa bzhi dang / brgyad dang / bcu drug dang / sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi grangs kyis so //
translated: The eight and twenty channels means the four wheels are counted as sixty-four, eight, sixteen, and thirty-two.

original: rtsa ni drug cu la yang brten //🔽zhes bya ba ni rten du gyur pa'i 'khor lo bzhi po rnams so //
analyzed: rtsa ni drug cu la yang brten // zhes bya ba ni rten du gyur pa'i 'khor lo bzhi po rnams so //
translated: The channels are also based on sixty.🔽The four wheels are the basis.

original: thun mtshams bzhi po rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo ni mtshams kyi rtsa'o //
analyzed: thun mtshams bzhi po rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo ni mtshams kyi rtsa'o //
translated: The channel junctures are the essence of the purity of the four periods.

original: rim pa yang zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo bzhi la rtsa bzhi po go rims kyis so //
analyzed: rim pa yang zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo bzhi la rtsa bzhi po go rims kyis so //
translated: The “sequence” is the four wheels, the four channels in sequence.

original: bzhi zhes bya ba ni mtshams kyi rtsa'o //
analyzed: bzhi zhes bya ba ni mtshams kyi rtsa'o //
translated: The “four” are the channels of the intermediate directions.

original: khyab ces bya ba ni lus thams cad la khyab par byas te /🔽gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab ces bya ba ni lus thams cad la khyab par byas te / gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Pervading” means pervading the whole body.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i dus kyi bar du'o //🔽de rnams zhes bya ba ni dga' ba dag dang ldan zhes bya ba ni dga' ba bzhi'i sbyor bas so //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i dus kyi bar du'o // de rnams zhes bya ba ni dga' ba dag dang ldan zhes bya ba ni dga' ba bzhi'i sbyor bas so //
translated: “Always” means until the time of death.

original: de rnams la ni khyab ces bya ba ni dga' ba bzhi la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams la ni khyab ces bya ba ni dga' ba bzhi la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: “Those” means those endowed with the joys. “By the application of the four joys” means by the application of the four joys.

original: de rnams zhes bya ba ni thun mtshams kyi rtsa bzhi po rnams kyis so //🔽padma'i snal ma lta bu yis //
analyzed: de rnams zhes bya ba ni thun mtshams kyi rtsa bzhi po rnams kyis so // padma'i snal ma lta bu yis //
translated: “Those” means the channels of the four intermediate directions.

original: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar padma snal ma'i rgyus pa rnams kyis khyab par byed pa de bzhin du dga' pa la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshams kyi rtsa de rnams la khyab par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar padma snal ma'i rgyus pa rnams kyis khyab par byed pa de bzhin du dga' pa la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshams kyi rtsa de rnams la khyab par byed pa'o //
translated: “Like the fibers of a lotus” means just as the fibers of a lotus pervade the stalk, so the channels of the intermediate directions of the joys and so on pervade those.

original: de ltar brten pa'i ngo bo mtshams kyi rtsa bzhi po la dga' ba bzhi'i rnam par gzhag pa brten nas /
analyzed: de ltar brten pa'i ngo bo mtshams kyi rtsa bzhi po la dga' ba bzhi'i rnam par gzhag pa brten nas /
translated: Thus, the nature of the supports is established as the four joys in the four channel petals of the juncture.

original: de rnams nyid la 'khor lo so so la snal ma rnam pa bzhi'i ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /🔽chu khams khongs su chud pa can //
analyzed: de rnams nyid la 'khor lo so so la snal ma rnam pa bzhi'i ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir / chu khams khongs su chud pa can //
translated: In order to demonstrate that the four channel petals in each of the chakras have the nature of the four nāḍīs,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “the water element is included within…” and so on.

original: chu khams khongs su chud pa can //🔽de ni de yis khyab pas so //
analyzed: chu khams khongs su chud pa can // de ni de yis khyab pas so //
translated: The water element is included within🔽the great bliss, because it is pervaded by that.

original: bde ba chen po zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems kyi ngo bo bde ba chen po ster bar byed pas so //🔽bde ba chen pos phan par byed //
analyzed: bde ba chen po zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems kyi ngo bo bde ba chen po ster bar byed pas so // bde ba chen pos phan par byed //
translated: “Great bliss” is the essence of bodhicitta, because it bestows great bliss.

original: ces bya ba ni bde ba chen po ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni bde ba chen po ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: “Great bliss benefits” means that great bliss is twofold:

original: yang dag par gso bar byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽'khor lo so so'i dbye ba ni //
analyzed: yang dag par gso bar byed pa'i phyir ro // 'khor lo so so'i dbye ba ni //
translated: because it is the cause of the arising of the bliss of the four joys, and because it is the cause of the increase of the bliss of the four joys.

original: zhes bya ba ni dga' ba la sogs pa bzhi'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dga' ba la sogs pa bzhi'i dbye bas so //
translated: “The divisions of each chakra” are the divisions of the four joys and so on.

original: dga' ba rnam pa bzhi bo ji ltar zhen /
analyzed: dga' ba rnam pa bzhi bo ji ltar zhen /
translated: How are there four joys?

original: de'i phyir longs spyod bzhi po @184a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir longs spyod bzhi po @184a * //
translated: Therefore, “the four enjoyments” and so on are stated.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: bzhi po rnams kyi longs spyod do //
analyzed: bzhi po rnams kyi longs spyod do //
translated: The enjoyment of the four.

original: dga' ba bzhi po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs rnams la nyi bar longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba bzhi po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs rnams la nyi bar longs spyod pa'o //
translated: The enjoyment of the four joys, etc., in the various situations.

original: yi ge ha zhes bya ba ni bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo gnas pa'i phyir byang chub kyi sems kyi zla ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge ha zhes bya ba ni bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo gnas pa'i phyir byang chub kyi sems kyi zla ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The syllable ha is the form of the moon of the bodhicitta, because it is located in the great-bliss wheel.

original: cha shas zhes bya ba ni cha shes so//
analyzed: cha shas zhes bya ba ni cha shes so//
translated: The parts are the portions.

original: shin tu phra ba'i zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems kyi thig le'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu phra ba'i zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems kyi thig le'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The very subtle is the form of the drop of the bodhicitta.

original: gnas zhes bya ba ni rnam bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba ni rnam bar gnas pa'o //
translated: The location is the support.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du'o //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du'o //
translated: Always is at all times.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /🔽de'i phyir // rten gyi tshul du khyab pas gnas //
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na / de'i phyir // rten gyi tshul du khyab pas gnas //
translated: How?🔽Therefore it is said:

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is located in the manner of a support.

original: khyab par byed pa ste lus thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa ste lus thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the pervader, because it pervades the entire body.

original: ji ltar zhe na /🔽rim pa bzhi yid bye ba las //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / rim pa bzhi yid bye ba las //
translated: How?

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: From the division of the four stages.

original: dga' ba'i rim pa'i dbye ba 'am //
analyzed: dga' ba'i rim pa'i dbye ba 'am //
translated: From the division of the stages of joy.

original: rim gyi dbye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim gyi dbye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the division into stages.

original: de ltar de rnams nyid la 'khor lo re rer rnam pa bzhi'i dngos po bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar de rnams nyid la 'khor lo re rer rnam pa bzhi'i dngos po bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the fourfold nature in each wheel,

original: da ni de'i rab tu dbye ba brjod pa'i phyir rim pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni de'i rab tu dbye ba brjod pa'i phyir rim pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: now, in order to state its division, he says, “stage,” etc.

original: 'khor lo bzhi'i rim pas so ;
analyzed: 'khor lo bzhi'i rim pas so ;
translated: by the stages of the four wheels.

original: / yang na dga' ba re re la lus dang ngag dang yid dang ye shes bzhi'i dbye bas rnam pa bcu drug pa nyid do //
analyzed: / yang na dga' ba re re la lus dang ngag dang yid dang ye shes bzhi'i dbye bas rnam pa bcu drug pa nyid do //
translated: Or else, each joy is divided into four: body, speech, mind, and gnosis, thus making sixteen.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir rim pa bcu drug dbye ba shes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir rim pa bcu drug dbye ba shes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach just that, he says, “the sixteen stages are to be known,” etc.

original: ji lta bu zhen /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhen /
translated: What is it like?

original: de'i phyir spro ba'i bdag nyid ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir spro ba'i bdag nyid ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “the nature of expansion,” etc.

original: rgyas pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis spros pa dang bcas pa'o phyir ro ;
analyzed: rgyas pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis spros pa dang bcas pa'o phyir ro ;
translated: because of the nature of expansion, it is endowed with elaboration.

original: / rmad 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid la yang rab tu dbye ba'i rnam par ba zhag pas /
analyzed: / rmad 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid la yang rab tu dbye ba'i rnam par ba zhag pas /
translated: “Wondrous” means that, because of the division of reality itself into parts,

original: shin tu yang ngo mtshar ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu yang ngo mtshar ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: it is also endowed with great wonder.

original: ro gcig pa yi go 'phang thob //
analyzed: ro gcig pa yi go 'phang thob //
translated: attains the state of one taste.

original: ces bya ba ni bde ba chen po nyams su myong bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs bcom pa gnyis su med pa nyid thob pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni bde ba chen po nyams su myong bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs bcom pa gnyis su med pa nyid thob pa ste /
translated: This is the attainment of the nondual state, which is the destruction of the opposing side through the experience of great bliss.

original: don gyi lhan cig skyes pa'i dus tshod la'o //
analyzed: don gyi lhan cig skyes pa'i dus tshod la'o //
translated: This is the time of the ultimate innate.

original: rim gyis so sor nyams myong bas //
analyzed: rim gyis so sor nyams myong bas //
translated: The experience of each one in sequence

original: zhes bya ba ni dga' ba la sogs pas nyams su myong ba'i rim pas cung zad tsam gyi bde ba dang de las lhag pa dang / chags bral dang / mtshan nyid thams cad dang bral ba'i bde ba'i dbye bas tha dad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dga' ba la sogs pas nyams su myong ba'i rim pas cung zad tsam gyi bde ba dang de las lhag pa dang / chags bral dang / mtshan nyid thams cad dang bral ba'i bde ba'i dbye bas tha dad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: is the experience of the stages of joy and so forth, which are differentiated by the categories of bliss, greater bliss, and the bliss free from attachment, and the bliss free from all characteristics.

original: de ltar de'i rab tu dbye ba bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar de'i rab tu dbye ba bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught its divisions,

original: da ni dpe'i sgo nas 'bras bu'i ngo bo brjod pa'i phyir /🔽sna tshogs chu yi sbyor ba las //
analyzed: da ni dpe'i sgo nas 'bras bu'i ngo bo brjod pa'i phyir / sna tshogs chu yi sbyor ba las //
translated: now, in order to express the nature of the result by means of an example,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “From the combination of various waters,”🔽and so forth.

original: chu'i sbyor ba sna tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: chu'i sbyor ba sna tshogs pa'o //
translated: The combination of various waters.

original: rgya mtsho'i chu bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rgya mtshor gnas pa'i chu bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i chu bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rgya mtshor gnas pa'i chu bzhin du'o //
translated: Like the water of the ocean.

original: rim gyis zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i rim pa la brten nas so //
analyzed: rim gyis zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i rim pa la brten nas so //
translated: “Gradually” means based on the stages of experience.

original: dus kyi 'khor lo zhes @184b bya ba ni nang gi dus nye bar mtshon pas so //
analyzed: dus kyi 'khor lo zhes @184b bya ba ni nang gi dus nye bar mtshon pas so //
translated: “Kālacakra” means the inner time is indicated.

original: sbyor ba bzhi zhes bya ba ni dga' ba bzhi'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba bzhi zhes bya ba ni dga' ba bzhi'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: “Four yogas” means because of the nature of the four joys.

original: dga' ba bzhi'i zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba bzhi'i zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
translated: “Four joys” means the connate joy.

original: de la brjod ces bya ba ni brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la brjod ces bya ba ni brjod par bya'o //
translated: “In that” means in that.

original: de ltar dpe'i sgo nas 'bras bu'i ngo bo bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar dpe'i sgo nas 'bras bu'i ngo bo bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the nature of the result by way of an example,

original: da ni de nyid la gdams ngag gi sgro nas thob par bya ba brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de nyid la gdams ngag gi sgro nas thob par bya ba brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach what is to be obtained by way of instruction in that,

original: rnal 'byor ma zhal brgyud las zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma zhal brgyud las zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “from the mouth of the yoginī.”

original: ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i zhal gyis kun du spyod pa las so //
analyzed: ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i zhal gyis kun du spyod pa las so //
translated: From the mouth of the wisdom dakini, the conduct is obtained.

original: 'go 'phang mchog ni thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'go 'phang mchog ni thob par 'gyur //
translated: “The supreme head” is obtained.

original: zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means the nature of the connate.

original: rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud dpal rdo rje phreng ba'i rgya cher 'grel pa /🔽pandi ta aa lam ka ka la shas mdzad pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud dpal rdo rje phreng ba'i rgya cher 'grel pa / pandi ta aa lam ka ka la shas mdzad pa /
translated: garland,

original: zab mo'i don shin tu gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: zab mo'i don shin tu gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba las /
translated: called “The Clarification of the Profound Meaning,”

original: le'u nyi shu rtsa dgu pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
analyzed: le'u nyi shu rtsa dgu pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
translated: is the extensive explanation of the twenty-ninth chapter.🔽Thus, having explained the reply to the question about the object

original: // / de ltar le'u nyi shu rtsa dgu pas dga' ba rnams bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yul la dri ba'i lan bstan nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar le'u nyi shu rtsa dgu pas dga' ba rnams bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yul la dri ba'i lan bstan nas /
translated: of the characteristics that generate the joys in twenty-nine chapters,🔽now, in order to explain the reply to the question about the object

original: da ni rtsa rnams kyis nges par rab tu 'bab pa'i mtshan nyid brjod pa'i yul la dri ba'i lan brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rtsa rnams kyis nges par rab tu 'bab pa'i mtshan nyid brjod pa'i yul la dri ba'i lan brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: expressed by the characteristics of the definite flow of the nāḍīs,

original: le'u sum cu pa nye par 'god cing dang por re zhig de rtsom pa ni /🔽de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: le'u sum cu pa nye par 'god cing dang por re zhig de rtsom pa ni / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: chapter 30 is set forth first.

original: le'u nyi shu rtsa dgu pa bshad pa'i rjes la'o //
analyzed: le'u nyi shu rtsa dgu pa bshad pa'i rjes la'o //
translated: The Explanation of the Twenty-ninth Chapter🔽The Explanation of the Chapter🔽The Explanation of the Chapter

original: rtsa rnams kyi rgyud bshad kyis nyon //🔽zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: rtsa rnams kyi rgyud bshad kyis nyon //🔽zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: The Explanation of the Chapter

original: des zhes bya ba ni khrag dang khu ba dang rlung rnams 'bab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni khrag dang khu ba dang rlung rnams 'bab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The it is blood, semen, and wind, because they flow.

original: de nyid kyis nyon zhes bya ba ni phyag na rdo rje thos pa las sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyis nyon zhes bya ba ni phyag na rdo rje thos pa las sbyor ba ste /
translated: The you is Vajrapāṇi, because he is engaged in hearing.

original: ji ltar gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is so called because of the nature of the abode.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By whom?

original: de'i phyir rdo rje brtan pa'i lus kyis zhes bya ba gsungs ta /
analyzed: de'i phyir rdo rje brtan pa'i lus kyis zhes bya ba gsungs ta /
translated: Therefore, it is said with a body firm as a vajra.

original: rdo rje bzhin du brtan pa ni sra ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje bzhin du brtan pa ni sra ba'o //
translated: Firm as a vajra is hard.

original: de lta bu'i lus gang rnams la yod pa de rnams la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i lus gang rnams la yod pa de rnams la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: Those who have such a body are called that.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa'i //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa'i //
translated: Those who are engaged in the stage of completion

original: sgom pa po rnams la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgom pa po rnams la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: are called meditators.

original: de ltar de rtsom pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar de rtsom pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the undertaking,

original: da ni de dngos su bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: da ni de dngos su bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir //
translated: now, in order to explain that in actuality,🔽in order to teach the sequence of the flow of the elements,

original: de'i yan lag sdud par byed rtsa rnams brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas khams 'bab pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i yan lag sdud par byed rtsa rnams brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas khams 'bab pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: with the enumeration of the channels that gather them as a preliminary,

original: stong phrag nyi shu rtsa bzhi ni ;
analyzed: stong phrag nyi shu rtsa bzhi ni ;
translated: it is said twenty-four thousand.

original: / zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The bodhicitta is the supreme wonder,

original: rtsa rnams sul thams cad la gnas pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: rtsa rnams sul thams cad la gnas pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: flowing in all the channels and pores.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i dus kyi bar du dus thams cad du'o //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i dus kyi bar du dus thams cad du'o //
translated: Always means at all times, up to the time of death.

original: rmad 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rang dang 'os pa'i khams 'bab par byed pas na gnas ngo mtshar ba dang bcas pa'o //🔽byang chub sems ni 'bab ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: rmad 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rang dang 'os pa'i khams 'bab par byed pas na gnas ngo mtshar ba dang bcas pa'o // byang chub sems ni 'bab ces bya ba ni /
translated: The supreme wonder is the abode of the marvelous, because it causes the flow of the appropriate elements.🔽The bodhicitta flows

original: @185a * // kun rdzob pa'i sems 'bab par byed pa rnams so //
analyzed: @185a * // kun rdzob pa'i sems 'bab par byed pa rnams so //
translated: means the relative bodhicitta flows.

original: bde ba thams cad rab tu 'phel //
analyzed: bde ba thams cad rab tu 'phel //
translated: All bliss increases

original: zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'jug pa rnams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'jug pa rnams so //
translated: means the bodhicitta that flows in the channels of the body increases.

original: bde ba thams cad ni gtso bo ma yin pa'i khams kyi ngo bo rnams kyi rjes su 'jug pa ni 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba thams cad ni gtso bo ma yin pa'i khams kyi ngo bo rnams kyi rjes su 'jug pa ni 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: All bliss is the increase of the essence of the secondary elements.

original: stong phrag nyi shu rtsa bzhi ni //
analyzed: stong phrag nyi shu rtsa bzhi ni //
translated: Twenty-four thousand

original: khrag 'bab par ni shes par bya //🔽zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: khrag 'bab par ni shes par bya // zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: should be known as the flow of blood.🔽As before, the twenty-four thousand should be known as the flow of blood.

original: khrag 'bab pa ni zhes bya ba ni nyi ma 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: khrag 'bab pa ni zhes bya ba ni nyi ma 'bab pa'o //
translated: The flow of blood is the flow of the sun.

original: nyi ma 'byung ba'i bdag nyid can //
analyzed: nyi ma 'byung ba'i bdag nyid can //
translated: The nature of the sun.

original: zhes bya ba ni rdul 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdul 'bab pa'o //
translated: This is the falling of the dust.

original: rtag tu rmad du 'byung pa'i rtsa //
analyzed: rtag tu rmad du 'byung pa'i rtsa //
translated: The always-wonderful channel,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: and so forth, is as before.

original: rlung rgyu bar ni shes par bya //
analyzed: rlung rgyu bar ni shes par bya //
translated: One should know the movement of the wind.

original: zhes bya ba ni rlung 'bab pa'o ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rlung 'bab pa'o ;
translated: This is the movement of the wind.🔽In order,

original: / rim bzhin zhes bya ba ni rlung rgyu ba'i rim pas so //🔽rgya chen rgyud las zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs pa 'am /
analyzed: / rim bzhin zhes bya ba ni rlung rgyu ba'i rim pas so // rgya chen rgyud las zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs pa 'am /
translated: means by the order of the movement of the wind.🔽In the great tantra,

original: rdo rje phreng ba'i rgyud chen po'i rjes su 'brangs nas so //🔽de ltar sdud par byed pa'i rtsa rnams brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas de'i khams 'bab pa bstan nas /
analyzed: rdo rje phreng ba'i rgyud chen po'i rjes su 'brangs nas so // de ltar sdud par byed pa'i rtsa rnams brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas de'i khams 'bab pa bstan nas /
translated: means following the Tantra Equal to Space, or following the great tantra of the Vajra Garland.🔽Thus, having explained the movement of the elements in those channels,

original: da ni sdud par byed pa'i rtsa brjod pa'i phyir //🔽lus kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni sdud par byed pa'i rtsa brjod pa'i phyir // lus kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: now, in order to explain the collecting channels,🔽it is said, “body, ” and so on.

original: lus kyi zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan gyi lus la'o //
analyzed: lus kyi zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan gyi lus la'o //
translated: Body means in one’s own and others’ bodies.

original: gnas kyi dbye ba yis zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: gnas kyi dbye ba yis zhes bya ba ni //
translated: The division of the locations is

original: gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i dbye bas so //
translated: the division into twenty-four, such as the location and the nearby location.

original: nyi shu rtsa bzhi zhes bya ba ni mi phyed ma la sogs pa'i ming can no //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa bzhi zhes bya ba ni mi phyed ma la sogs pa'i ming can no //
translated: The twenty-four are those named unbroken and so forth.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi rtsa rnams so //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi rtsa rnams so //
translated: The that is the seventy-two thousand channels.

original: brjod ces bya ba ni gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: brjod ces bya ba ni gsungs pa'o //
translated: The said is the teaching.

original: stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi grangs can gyi rtsa rnams ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi po rnams kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi grangs can gyi rtsa rnams ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi po rnams kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The seventy-two thousand channels are included in the twenty-four.

original: de ltar sdud par byed pa'i rtsa rnams bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar sdud par byed pa'i rtsa rnams bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the channels that gather,

original: da ni rgya cher brjod pa la lugs brjod pa'i phyir /🔽thim dang longs spyod bdag po nyid //
analyzed: da ni rgya cher brjod pa la lugs brjod pa'i phyir / thim dang longs spyod bdag po nyid //
translated: now, in order to explain the extensive description,

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, dissolution, enjoyment, and ownership.

original: byang chub sems kyi zla ba'i kun du spyod pa gsum pa brten nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems kyi zla ba'i kun du spyod pa gsum pa brten nas /
translated: Having relied on the third practice of the moon of bodhicitta,

original: de rnams nyid sdud par byed pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de rnams nyid sdud par byed pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: those are the twenty-four gatherers.

original: bdun cu rtsa gnyis brjod ces bya ba ni thim pa dang longs spyod pa dang / bdag po nyid gsum gyi nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i rtsa rnams kyi grangs kyis bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi grangs 'byung ba las so //
analyzed: bdun cu rtsa gnyis brjod ces bya ba ni thim pa dang longs spyod pa dang / bdag po nyid gsum gyi nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i rtsa rnams kyi grangs kyis bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi grangs 'byung ba las so //
translated: The statement “the seventy-two are mentioned” is because the number seventy-two arises from the number twenty-four of the three—dissolution, enjoyment, and ownership.

original: re rer 'ang 'khor ni stong ngo //
analyzed: re rer 'ang 'khor ni stong ngo //
translated: Each has a retinue of one thousand.

original: zhes bya ba ni rtsa re re yang rgyas par ni 'khor ni stong ste stong gi grangs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtsa re re yang rgyas par ni 'khor ni stong ste stong gi grangs so //
translated: The statement “each has a retinue of one thousand” is because each nāḍī has a retinue of one thousand, that is, a number of one thousand.

original: rigs brgya'i dbye ba gnas la sogs pa bcus bsgyur na /
analyzed: rigs brgya'i dbye ba gnas la sogs pa bcus bsgyur na /
translated: If the one hundred families are multiplied by the ten, such as the location,

original: re re la stong phrag @185b gi grangs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: re re la stong phrag @185b gi grangs su shes par bya'o //
translated: each should be understood to have a number of one thousand.

original: de ltar rgya cher brjod pa'i lugs bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rgya cher brjod pa'i lugs bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the system of extensive enumeration in that way,

original: da ni nye bar bsdu ba'i lugs brjod par bya ba'i phyir /🔽gtso bo yang ni bsdus pa las //
analyzed: da ni nye bar bsdu ba'i lugs brjod par bya ba'i phyir / gtso bo yang ni bsdus pa las //
translated: now, in order to explain the system of concise enumeration,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “the principal ones are also condensed.”

original: slar yang bsdus nas 'gro ba dang // zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: slar yang bsdus nas 'gro ba dang // zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: It is related to “again, having condensed.”

original: thim pa longs spyod bdag por dor /
analyzed: thim pa longs spyod bdag por dor /
translated: The dissolution, enjoyment, and ownership are abandoned.

original: zhes bya ba ni bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi grangs rnams la sum 'gyur gyi grangs phri bas so //🔽gnas rnams kyi ni grangs su 'gyur //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi grangs rnams la sum 'gyur gyi grangs phri bas so // gnas rnams kyi ni grangs su 'gyur //
translated: Thus, the number seventy-two is reduced by the number three.🔽The number of the abodes

original: zhes bya ba ni gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa'i grangs rnams kyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa'i grangs rnams kyis so //
translated: The number of the abodes and the neighboring abodes, etc.

original: slar yang bsdus nas 'gro ba ni //
analyzed: slar yang bsdus nas 'gro ba ni //
translated: Again, they are included

original: zhes bya ba ni bdun cu rtsa gnyis pa'i nang du 'dus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdun cu rtsa gnyis pa'i nang du 'dus par 'gyur ro //
translated: They are included in the number seventy-two.

original: grangs rnams ji tsam zhe na /🔽de'i phyir / gsum dang rnam brgyad dbye ba yis //
analyzed: grangs rnams ji tsam zhe na / de'i phyir / gsum dang rnam brgyad dbye ba yis //
translated: How many are there?🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: By the division into three and eight,

original: nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i grangs can gyi rtsa rnams la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i grangs can gyi rtsa rnams la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The number of the channels is twenty-four.🔽The number of the channels is twenty-four.

original: rnam pa brgyad pa la rnam pa gsum gyis grangs su byas na snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad pa la rnam pa gsum gyis grangs su byas na snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The number eight is made into three parts.

original: de rnams kyang phra mo phra mo'i cha shas kyis bsdus pas na /
analyzed: de rnams kyang phra mo phra mo'i cha shas kyis bsdus pas na /
translated: They are also included in the subtle parts.

original: 'dus par 'gyur ro snyam du bstan pa'i phyir rtsa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dus par 'gyur ro snyam du bstan pa'i phyir rtsa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that they are gathered, he declares the channels, etc.

original: nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i grangs so //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i grangs so //
translated: The number is twenty-four.

original: nyin mtshan dbye ba yis zhes bya ba ni nyin mtshan gcig la phal ched chung tshod sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can la 'dus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyin mtshan dbye ba yis zhes bya ba ni nyin mtshan gcig la phal ched chung tshod sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can la 'dus par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the division of day and night means that in one day and night, they are gathered in the nature of thirty-two half-hours.

original: de yang thun brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: de yang thun brgyad pa'o //
translated: Moreover, they are eight periods.

original: de yang skad cig la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de yang skad cig la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Moreover, they are one instant.

original: nang du 'gro bar shes par bya /
analyzed: nang du 'gro bar shes par bya /
translated: One should know that they go within.

original: zhes pa ni shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni shes par bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is to be known.

original: bdun cu rtsa gnyis dang / nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang / chu tshod sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / thun brgyad dang / skad cig ma gcig gi rab tu dbye bas gong nas gong du bsdus nas 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdun cu rtsa gnyis dang / nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang / chu tshod sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / thun brgyad dang / skad cig ma gcig gi rab tu dbye bas gong nas gong du bsdus nas 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the division of seventy-two, twenty-four, thirty-two half-hours, eight periods, and one instant, they are gathered in ascending order.

original: de ltar don rnam pa bzhis rtsa'i mdor bstan pa bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar don rnam pa bzhis rtsa'i mdor bstan pa bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the summary of the channels by way of four topics in that way,

original: da ni de rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to explain that extensively, he declares,

original: de'i yan lag rtsa gsum gyi khams 'bab pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir /🔽g-yon pa byang chub zla ba 'bab //
analyzed: de'i yan lag rtsa gsum gyi khams 'bab pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir / g-yon pa byang chub zla ba 'bab //
translated: In order to teach the sequence of the flow of the three constituents in the branches of that,

original: ces gsungs te /
analyzed: ces gsungs te /
translated: it is said:🔽The left is the flow of the moon of enlightenment.

original: g-yon pa shes bya ba ni g-yon pa'i cha la'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa shes bya ba ni g-yon pa'i cha la'o //
translated: The left is the left side.

original: kun rdzob kyi sems kyi zla ba 'bab pa'o //🔽g-yas pa khrag dang nyi ma 'bab //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi sems kyi zla ba 'bab pa'o // g-yas pa khrag dang nyi ma 'bab //
translated: The flow of the moon of the conventional mind.🔽The right is the flow of blood and the sun.

original: ces bya ba ni g-yas pa'i cha la nyi ma'i rang bzhin gyi khrag 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni g-yas pa'i cha la nyi ma'i rang bzhin gyi khrag 'bab pa'o //
translated: The right side is the flow of blood, which has the nature of the sun.

original: shes bya dbus su rlung rgyu bas //
analyzed: shes bya dbus su rlung rgyu bas //
translated: The object of knowledge is the flow of the wind in the middle.

original: zhes bya ba ni dbus kyi gnas su rnam par mi rtog pa'i rlung dang dus kyi me 'bab pa'o//
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dbus kyi gnas su rnam par mi rtog pa'i rlung dang dus kyi me 'bab pa'o//
translated: The object of knowledge is the middle place, where the wind of non-conceptuality and the fire of time flow.

original: @186a * // gdams ngag las kyang rtsa gsum po dbus kyi mdud pa brjod par 'dod pas drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @186a * // gdams ngag las kyang rtsa gsum po dbus kyi mdud pa brjod par 'dod pas drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, in the oral instructions, the three channels are said to be the middle knot, so there are six.

original: de rnams kyang steng 'og gi dbye bas khams drug 'bab par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyang steng 'og gi dbye bas khams drug 'bab par byed pa'o //
translated: Those are the six constituents that flow through the division of above and below.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bshad gci zla ba nyi ma dang // sgra gcan dus kyi me rtsa rnams //
analyzed: bshad gci zla ba nyi ma dang // sgra gcan dus kyi me rtsa rnams //
translated: The channels of urine, feces, moon, sun, Rāhu, and the fire of time,

original: drug ces bya ba la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: drug ces bya ba la sogs pa'o ;
translated: The six and so forth.

original: / ming bstan pa'i phyir /🔽la la n'a dang ra sa n'a /
analyzed: / ming bstan pa'i phyir / la la n'a dang ra sa n'a /
translated: In order to teach the names,

original: aa wa dh'u t'i zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: aa wa dh'u t'i zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says lalanā, rasanā, and avadhūtī.

original: 'dir ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: Here, it is just as in the sūtras.

original: de ltar rtsa gsum po la khams 'bab pa'i rim pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rtsa gsum po la khams 'bab pa'i rim pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the sequence of the flow of the constituents in the three nāḍīs,

original: da ni de rnams kyi spro ba'i rim pa brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de rnams kyi spro ba'i rim pa brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to explain the sequence of their emanation,

original: de rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says those, and so on.

original: rtsa gsum po rnams so //
analyzed: rtsa gsum po rnams so //
translated: The three nāḍīs.

original: spro ba'i sbyor ba yis zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa'i sbyor bas so //
analyzed: spro ba'i sbyor ba yis zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa'i sbyor bas so //
translated: By the yoga of emanation means by the yoga of enhancement.

original: brgyad ces bya ba ni rtsa brgyad kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: brgyad ces bya ba ni rtsa brgyad kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: Eight means the nature of eight nāḍīs.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rim gyis thun brgyad ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rim gyis thun brgyad ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: He says in sequence, eight periods,

original: thun brgyad kyi rim pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thun brgyad kyi rim pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: meaning by the sequence of eight periods.

original: re re yang zhes bya ba ni nyi shu rtsa bzhir 'gro zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: re re yang zhes bya ba ni nyi shu rtsa bzhir 'gro zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: Each is connected to goes to twenty-four.

original: re re yang thun brgyad kyi grangs so //
analyzed: re re yang thun brgyad kyi grangs so //
translated: Each is counted as eight periods.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de'i phyir gsum po zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsum po zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, he says,

original: gsum gyis bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: gsum gyis bsgyur ba'o //
translated: three times.

original: ji skad ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji skad ston par 'gyur te /
translated: How is it taught?

original: gang zhig rtsa gsum po 'di thun brgyad po'i grangs kyis rgyud du 'gro ba de rnams nyid la gsum gyis bsgyur bas nyi shu rtsa bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig rtsa gsum po 'di thun brgyad po'i grangs kyis rgyud du 'gro ba de rnams nyid la gsum gyis bsgyur bas nyi shu rtsa bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Those which flow through the three channels in the enumeration of the eight periods become twenty-four by multiplying by three.

original: slar yang zhes bya ba ni de'i rjes la slar yang /
analyzed: slar yang zhes bya ba ni de'i rjes la slar yang /
translated: Again, after that, again.

original: thim dang longs spyod bdag po'i phyir //
analyzed: thim dang longs spyod bdag po'i phyir //
translated: Dissolution, enjoyment, and mastery.

original: zhes bya ba ni de ma thag par bstan pa'i nyi shu rtsa bzhi byang chub sems kyi kun du spyod pa'i rim pa gsum gyis bsgyur bas bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi grangs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de ma thag par bstan pa'i nyi shu rtsa bzhi byang chub sems kyi kun du spyod pa'i rim pa gsum gyis bsgyur bas bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi grangs su 'gyur ro //
translated: The twenty-four just explained become seventy-two by multiplying by the three stages of the conduct of bodhicitta.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: rim gyis grangs ni bdun cu gnyis //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rim gyis grangs ni bdun cu gnyis // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: the sequence of seventy-two.

original: de ma thag par bstan pa'i grangs kyi rim pas so //
analyzed: de ma thag par bstan pa'i grangs kyi rim pas so //
translated: The sequence of the enumeration just explained.

original: slar yang de zhes bya ba ni bdun cu rtsa gnyis so //
analyzed: slar yang de zhes bya ba ni bdun cu rtsa gnyis so //
translated: Again, that is, seventy-two.

original: de spro ba yi sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: de spro ba yi sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the yoga of their emission,

original: zhes bya ba ni rgya chen po'i sbyor bas so //🔽re re stong dbye ba yis //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgya chen po'i sbyor bas so // re re stong dbye ba yis //
translated: By the yoga of their vastness.🔽Each one divided by a thousand,

original: zhes bya ba ni stong phrag gi grangs nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni stong phrag gi grangs nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The number becomes a thousand.

original: nges par grangs nyid 'gyur ba ni //
analyzed: nges par grangs nyid 'gyur ba ni //
translated: The number is definitely changed

original: zhes bya ba ni stong stong gis bsgyur bas bdun cu rtsa gnyis stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi grangs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni stong stong gis bsgyur bas bdun cu rtsa gnyis stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi grangs su 'gyur ro //
translated: By multiplying by a thousand, the number becomes seventy-two thousand.

original: de ltar de rnams nyid kyi spro ba'i rim pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar de rnams nyid kyi spro ba'i rim pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the stages of their emission,

original: da ni gsum po slar yang gcig gi khongs su bsdu ba brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni gsum po slar yang gcig gi khongs su bsdu ba brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to state that the three again are included within one,🔽he says,

original: gtso bo zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gtso bo zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The principal

original: gtso @186b bo gsum ni /
analyzed: gtso @186b bo gsum ni /
translated: The three principal ones are

original: la la n'a dang / ra sa n'a dang / aa wa dh'u t'i'o //
analyzed: la la n'a dang / ra sa n'a dang / aa wa dh'u t'i'o //
translated: lalanā, rasanā, and avadhūtī.🔽By the yoga,

original: sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni g-yas pa dang g-yon pa'i rlung rgyu ba dbus mar 'jug pa'i sbyor bas so //
analyzed: sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni g-yas pa dang g-yon pa'i rlung rgyu ba dbus mar 'jug pa'i sbyor bas so //
translated: by the yoga of the movement of the right and left winds entering the central one.

original: gcig pa nyid du 'gro zhes bya ba ni rtsa dbus ma'i ngo bor 'gro bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid du 'gro zhes bya ba ni rtsa dbus ma'i ngo bor 'gro bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Becoming one” means becoming of the nature of the central channel.

original: de ltar gsum po gcig gi khongs su bsdu pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar gsum po gcig gi khongs su bsdu pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the inclusion of the three within one,

original: da ni rtsa dbus ma'i ngo bo brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rtsa dbus ma'i ngo bo brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to describe the nature of the central channel,

original: shes par dka' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: shes par dka' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “difficult to know,” and so on.

original: las dang po pa'i rnal 'byor ba rnams la mtshon par dka' ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: las dang po pa'i rnal 'byor ba rnams la mtshon par dka' ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is difficult to illustrate for beginner yogins.

original: phra ba de ni zhes bya ba ni skra'i rtse mo'i mthar thug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: phra ba de ni zhes bya ba ni skra'i rtse mo'i mthar thug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: “That subtle one” is because of the extremity of the tip of a hair.

original: dang po las kyi rnal 'byor pas //
analyzed: dang po las kyi rnal 'byor pas //
translated: The beginner yogin

original: zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa'i rim pa sgom pa po'i rnal 'byor pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa'i rim pa sgom pa po'i rnal 'byor pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means the yogin who meditates on the creation stage.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya ba ni sems kyi spyod yul las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya ba ni sems kyi spyod yul las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: “Inconceivable” is because of being beyond the domain of the mind.

original: mchog tu zhes bya ba ni spros pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog tu zhes bya ba ni spros pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: “Supreme” is because of being free from elaborations.

original: thig le n'a da rnam par spangs //
analyzed: thig le n'a da rnam par spangs //
translated: The bindu is free from nāda.

original: zhes bya ba ni rdzas dang brag ca'i sgra spangs pas so ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdzas dang brag ca'i sgra spangs pas so ;
translated: This is because it is free from substance and echo.

original: / bde ba kun gyi gzhi zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i bde ba la brten pa'o //
analyzed: / bde ba kun gyi gzhi zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i bde ba la brten pa'o //
translated: The basis of all bliss is the support of uncontaminated bliss.

original: gsang ba zhes bya ba ni zab mo'o //
analyzed: gsang ba zhes bya ba ni zab mo'o //
translated: Secret means profound.

original: srog gi rten gyi mtshan nyid dang // zhes bya ba ni srog gi rlung gi rten nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: srog gi rten gyi mtshan nyid dang // zhes bya ba ni srog gi rlung gi rten nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The characteristic of the support of life is because it is the support of the life-force wind.

original: nag po'i rtsar ni rnam par bshad //
analyzed: nag po'i rtsar ni rnam par bshad //
translated: It is explained as the black nāḍī.

original: ces bya ba ni mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because it has the nature of nonapprehending.

original: rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug dang // zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug dang // zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The lord of the vajra realm is the essence of the wisdom of Mahāvajradhara.

original: de ltar rtsa dbus ma'i ngo bo bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rtsa dbus ma'i ngo bo bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the nature of the central nāḍī,

original: da ni de la man ngag gis rtogs par bya ba nyid brjod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: da ni de la man ngag gis rtogs par bya ba nyid brjod pa'i phyir //
translated: now, in order to explain the realization of the intimate instruction on that,

original: rnal 'byor ma'i zhal nas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma'i zhal nas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “from the mouth of Yoginī.”

original: ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i zhal gyi gdams ngag gis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i zhal gyi gdams ngag gis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It should be realized through the intimate instructions of the mouth of the dakini of Timeless Awareness.

original: ro gcig go 'phang bdag nyid can //
analyzed: ro gcig go 'phang bdag nyid can //
translated: The state of one taste.

original: zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzlog nas gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzlog nas gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because, having turned away from the conception of difference, it is the nature of nondual wisdom.

original: rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud dpal rdo rje phreng ba'i rgya cher 'grel pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud dpal rdo rje phreng ba'i rgya cher 'grel pa /
translated: The extensive commentary on the glorious Vajra Garland Tantra of the great yoga

original: pandi ta aa lam ka ka la shas mdzad pa /
analyzed: pandi ta aa lam ka ka la shas mdzad pa /
translated: by the paṇḍita Alaṃkakalaśa

original: zab mo'i don shin tu gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: zab mo'i don shin tu gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba las /
translated: called Clarifying the Profound Meaning

original: le'u sum cu pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
analyzed: le'u sum cu pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
translated: is the extensive explanation of the thirtieth chapter.

original: // / de ltar le'u sum cu pas rtsa rnams kyi nges par 'bab pa'i mtshan nyid yul la dri ba'i lan brjod nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar le'u sum cu pas rtsa rnams kyi nges par 'bab pa'i mtshan nyid yul la dri ba'i lan brjod nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the reply to the question about the characteristics of the definite flow of the nāḍīs in the thirty-first chapter,

original: da ni mtshams kyi rtsa gsum gyi yul la dri ba'i lan brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni mtshams kyi rtsa gsum gyi yul la dri ba'i lan brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to explain the reply to the question about the three junction nāḍīs,

original: le'u sum cu rtsa @187a * //
analyzed: le'u sum cu rtsa @187a * //
translated: the thirty-first chapter is set out.

original: gcig pa nye bar 'god cing re zhig dang por de'i rtsom pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gcig pa nye bar 'god cing re zhig dang por de'i rtsom pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the composition of that chapter,

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the words “after that” and so on are stated.

original: le'u sum cu pa bshad pa'i rjes la'o //
analyzed: le'u sum cu pa bshad pa'i rjes la'o //
translated: After explaining the thirty chapters,

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Again is as before.

original: mtshams kyi rtsa ni gtso bo nyid bshad kyis nyon zhes bya ba dang 'brel to//
analyzed: mtshams kyi rtsa ni gtso bo nyid bshad kyis nyon zhes bya ba dang 'brel to//
translated: The root of the boundary is explained as the principal one, so listen.

original: des ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: des ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What does that do?

original: de'i phyir gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, by which...

original: rtsa gsum po gang las so //
analyzed: rtsa gsum po gang las so //
translated: From which of the three nāḍīs?

original: rtsa rnams sdom dang 'char ba dang // zhes bya ba la sdom pa ni bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa rnams sdom dang 'char ba dang // zhes bya ba la sdom pa ni bsdus pa'o //
translated: The nāḍīs are the binding and arising. Binding is gathering.

original: 'char ba ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'char ba ni skye ba'o //
translated: Arising is birth.

original: sdom pa yang yin la 'char ba yang yin pas na sdom pa dang 'char ba'o //
analyzed: sdom pa yang yin la 'char ba yang yin pas na sdom pa dang 'char ba'o //
translated: Since they are both binding and arising, they are binding and arising.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du'o //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du'o //
translated: Always is at all times.

original: de ltar de'i rtsom pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar de'i rtsom pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus explained the composition,

original: da ni dngos su bstan pa bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dngos su bstan pa bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to explain the actual teaching,

original: sdom pa mdor bstan pa'i yan lag rang gi ngo bo bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sdom pa mdor bstan pa'i yan lag rang gi ngo bo bstan pa ni /
translated: the branch that concisely explains the binding is taught:

original: mchog tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mchog tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The supreme... and so on.

original: rtsa rnams kyi spros pa bzlog pa'i bdag nyid can gyis so //
analyzed: rtsa rnams kyi spros pa bzlog pa'i bdag nyid can gyis so //
translated: By the nature of the reversal of the proliferation of the nāḍīs.

original: mchog tu dga' ba nyams myong zhes bya ba ni so so rang gis rig par bya ba nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid can byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo'o //🔽lha yi ye shes gsal bar byed //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba nyams myong zhes bya ba ni so so rang gis rig par bya ba nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid can byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo'o // lha yi ye shes gsal bar byed //
translated: The experience of supreme joy is the nature of the experience of the individual’s self-awareness, the essence of bodhicitta.

original: ces bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lhan cig skyes pa gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lhan cig skyes pa gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: The clarity of the gnosis of the deity is the nature of the clarity of the transcendent connate state.

original: gsal ba'i sngags su yang dag par sbyor zhes bya ba ni gsal ba ni thams cad kyi gtso bo h'um yig la yang dag par sbyar ba ni /
analyzed: gsal ba'i sngags su yang dag par sbyor zhes bya ba ni gsal ba ni thams cad kyi gtso bo h'um yig la yang dag par sbyar ba ni /
translated: The union with the clear mantra is the union with the clear syllable hūṃ, the principal one of all.

original: rlung gsum po la cha shas su yongs su rtogs pas 'brel ba'i phyir ro //🔽lha yi rnal 'byor don nges pa //
analyzed: rlung gsum po la cha shas su yongs su rtogs pas 'brel ba'i phyir ro // lha yi rnal 'byor don nges pa //
translated: It is the connection with the three vāyus because it is the complete understanding of the parts.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i rlung 'byed pas lha ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i rlung 'byed pas lha ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: The deity yoga of ascertaining the meaning is the transcendent deity because it separates the conceptual vāyu.

original: rnal 'byor gyi don ni don dam pa'i de kho na nyid nges par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi don ni don dam pa'i de kho na nyid nges par 'byed pa'o //
translated: The meaning of yoga is the ascertainment of the reality of the ultimate.

original: de nyid gsum sbyor zhes bya ba ni lus la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de nyid gsum sbyor zhes bya ba ni lus la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis so //
translated: The union of the three realities is by the nature of the purity of body, etc.

original: dri ma med ces bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i rlung gi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dri ma med ces bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i rlung gi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Stainless means that it is the nature of the wind of non-conceptuality.

original: rdo rje gsum don gcig tu sdom //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum don gcig tu sdom //
translated: The meaning of the three vajras is summarized as one.

original: zhes bya ba ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa rnams kyi don gcig pa ni don gcig pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa rnams kyi don gcig pa ni don gcig pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the one meaning of the vajras of body, etc. is the one meaning,

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bo'o //
translated: which is the nature of Great Vajradhara.

original: de'i sdom pa ni sdud pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i sdom pa ni sdud pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Its summary is the nature of the collection.

original: 'jig rten gsum du khyab cing zhes bya ba ni khams gsum la khyab pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum du khyab cing zhes bya ba ni khams gsum la khyab pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It pervades the three worlds means that it pervades the three realms.

original: phra zhes bya ba ni phra mo'i rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba nyid kyi phyir @187b ro ;
analyzed: phra zhes bya ba ni phra mo'i rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba nyid kyi phyir @187b ro ;
translated: Subtle means that it is to be realized by subtle yogis.

original: / lus kun la ni yang dag brten //
analyzed: / lus kun la ni yang dag brten //
translated: It is well-established in the entire body.

original: zhes bya ba ni lus thams cad la khyab par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lus thams cad la khyab par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it pervades the entire body.

original: ye shes sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa gcig pu'i spyod yul nyid kyis longs spyod rdzogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa gcig pu'i spyod yul nyid kyis longs spyod rdzogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The “wisdom being” is the nature of the enjoyment body, because it is the domain of the solitary yogin.

original: rdo rje sems zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro//
analyzed: rdo rje sems zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro//
translated: The “vajra being” is the nature of the Dharma body.

original: dam tshig sems dpa' ste zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i sku'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dam tshig sems dpa' ste zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i sku'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The “commitment being” is the nature of the emanation body.

original: gang phyir bde zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis kyis bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gang phyir bde zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis kyis bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin no //
translated: “Because of bliss” means the nature of great bliss in two aspects.

original: rnal 'byor mchog tu shes par bya //
analyzed: rnal 'byor mchog tu shes par bya //
translated: It should be known as the supreme yoga.

original: zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo'o //
translated: This is the nature of the unexcelled meditative concentration.

original: khyab pa'i zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa la ltos nas so //
analyzed: khyab pa'i zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa la ltos nas so //
translated: “Pervasive” means in relation to natural purity.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni don dam pa nyid kyis phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni don dam pa nyid kyis phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Reality” means non-erroneous by means of ultimate reality.

original: rmad 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'bad pa med pas sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmad 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'bad pa med pas sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The wondrous is because of the benefit of sentient beings through effortless activity.

original: mchog dang rab mchog ces bya ba ni dga' ba la sogs pa gsum las so //
analyzed: mchog dang rab mchog ces bya ba ni dga' ba la sogs pa gsum las so //
translated: The supreme and excellent are because of the three joys, etc.

original: rab mchog ni lhan cig skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rab mchog ni lhan cig skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The excellent is because of the nature of the innate.

original: phra zhes bya ba ni skra'i rtse mo bye ba brgya'i cha'i chad tsam gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: phra zhes bya ba ni skra'i rtse mo bye ba brgya'i cha'i chad tsam gyi phyir ro //
translated: The subtle is because of the size of a hundredth part of the tip of a hair.

original: rang 'byung ye shes zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang 'byung ye shes zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The self-arisen gnosis is because of the absence of arising through causes and conditions.

original: mi zad pa zhes bya ba ni skye 'jig dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi zad pa zhes bya ba ni skye 'jig dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The inexhaustible is because of the absence of arising and cessation.

original: de ltar sdom pa mdor bstan pa'i ngo bo bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar sdom pa mdor bstan pa'i ngo bo bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the essence of the concise explanation of the vows,

original: da ni rtsa ba'i rtsa bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: da ni rtsa ba'i rtsa bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: now, in order to teach the root of the root,🔽it is said:

original: sum cu rtsa gnyis byang chub 'bab //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gnyis byang chub 'bab // ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The thirty-two enter into enlightenment.

original: so dang sen mo la sogs pa byang chub kyi sems sum cu rtsa gnyis po rnams la'o //
analyzed: so dang sen mo la sogs pa byang chub kyi sems sum cu rtsa gnyis po rnams la'o //
translated: The thirty-two bodhicitta [bindus] are in the teeth, nails, and so on.

original: 'bab ces bya ba ni 'dzag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'bab ces bya ba ni 'dzag par byed pa'o //
translated: “Flow” means to drip.

original: rtsa ni zhes bya ba ni rtsa'o //
analyzed: rtsa ni zhes bya ba ni rtsa'o //
translated: “Channel” means a channel.

original: thams cad mchog tu zhes bya ba ni rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi ngo bo rnams so //
analyzed: thams cad mchog tu zhes bya ba ni rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi ngo bo rnams so //
translated: “Supreme” means the essence of the seventy-two thousand channels.

original: gsal zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa la de snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa la de snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Clear” means that it appears to the consciousness of the yogi.

original: bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo gnas //
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo gnas //
translated: It is located in the great-bliss wheel.

original: zhes bya ba ni mgo bor gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mgo bor gnas pa'o //
translated: This means that it is located in the head.

original: rtsa zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i rtsa rnams lus thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsa zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i rtsa rnams lus thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Channel” means that the other channels pervade the entire body.

original: gang du zhe na /🔽de'i phyir cha rnams kun bdag nyid //
analyzed: gang du zhe na / de'i phyir cha rnams kun bdag nyid //
translated: Where?

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “in all the parts of the body.”

original: rtsa'i tshogs ma lus pa lus la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtsa'i tshogs ma lus pa lus la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that the entire collection of channels is in the body.

original: de ltar rnam pa gnyis kyis sdom pa mdor bstan pa bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gnyis kyis sdom pa mdor bstan pa bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the concise explanation of the two types of vows in this way,

original: da ni mtshams kyi rtsa rnams rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni mtshams kyi rtsa rnams rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to extensively explain the channel junctures,

original: de'i yan lag rang gi ngo bo ni /
analyzed: de'i yan lag rang gi ngo bo ni /
translated: its limbs are its own nature.

original: de'i dbus na zhes @188a * //🔽bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i dbus na zhes @188a * // bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In the middle of that, etc.

original: rtsa rnams sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi grangs can gyi dbus na'o //
analyzed: rtsa rnams sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi grangs can gyi dbus na'o //
translated: In the middle of the thirty-two channel petals.

original: rtsa gsum ste zhes bya ba ni gsum mo //🔽gtso bor yang ni yang dag bshad //
analyzed: rtsa gsum ste zhes bya ba ni gsum mo // gtso bor yang ni yang dag bshad //
translated: Three channels, i.e., three.🔽Are explained as the principal ones.

original: ces bya ba ni gtso bor brjod do //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gtso bor brjod do //
translated: Are described as the principal ones.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /🔽de'i phyir / zla ba nyi ma me rgyu ba //
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na / de'i phyir / zla ba nyi ma me rgyu ba //
translated: How so?🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: The moon, sun, and fire move.

original: khu ba dang khrag dang dus kyi me 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: khu ba dang khrag dang dus kyi me 'bab pa'o //
translated: The semen, blood, and menstrual fire flow.

original: 'byung ba thams cad la ni khyab //
analyzed: 'byung ba thams cad la ni khyab //
translated: They pervade all the elements.

original: ces bya ba ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i ngo bo 'khor lo bzhi la khyab par byed pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i ngo bo 'khor lo bzhi la khyab par byed pa ste /
translated: They pervade the four wheels, which are the nature of the four great elements,

original: de rnams med par de rnams mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams med par de rnams mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not occur without them.

original: de ltar rang gi ngo bo bstan nas //
analyzed: de ltar rang gi ngo bo bstan nas //
translated: Having thus taught their nature,

original: de nyid la dpe bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de nyid la dpe bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: in order to teach the example of that,🔽it is said:

original: ji ltar shing rtsa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te //
analyzed: ji ltar shing rtsa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te //
translated: Just as the tree roots, etc.

original: sa las skyes pa la'o //
analyzed: sa las skyes pa la'o //
translated: Grow from the earth.

original: sa la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni sa'i nang du gnas pa'i rtsa ba rnams so //
analyzed: sa la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni sa'i nang du gnas pa'i rtsa ba rnams so //
translated: “Situated in the earth” are the roots situated in the earth.

original: cung zad ces bya ba ni cung zad tsam gyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: cung zad ces bya ba ni cung zad tsam gyi ngo bo'o //
translated: “A little” is the nature of a little.

original: gnas zhes bya ba ni bstan par byas nas so //
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba ni bstan par byas nas so //
translated: “Situated” is after having been indicated.

original: sdong bu yal ga kha phye ba //
analyzed: sdong bu yal ga kha phye ba //
translated: The trunk, branches, and leaves

original: sogs pa yis ni kun la khyab //
analyzed: sogs pa yis ni kun la khyab //
translated: are pervaded by the “etc.”

original: ces bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad du'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad du'o //
translated: “In every way” is in all aspects.

original: de ltar dpe brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar dpe brjod nas /
translated: Having thus given the example,

original: da ni don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach the meaning,

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “just so,” etc.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni shing gi rtsa ba ltar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni shing gi rtsa ba ltar ro //
translated: “Just so” is like the root of the tree.

original: skyes bu zhes bya ba ni mi'o //
analyzed: skyes bu zhes bya ba ni mi'o //
translated: “The person” is the human being.

original: mgor gnas pa /
analyzed: mgor gnas pa /
translated: “Situated in the head”

original: rtsa gsum la ni zhes bya ba ni mgo bo la gnas pa'i la la n'a la sogs pa gsum mo //
analyzed: rtsa gsum la ni zhes bya ba ni mgo bo la gnas pa'i la la n'a la sogs pa gsum mo //
translated: “In the three channels” are the three, lalanā, etc., situated in the head.

original: rnyog pa med ces bya ba ni phan tshun brgyud pas khams rnams ma 'dres pa'i phyir dang / rlung gi rgyu ba yang dus bzang po'i rigs pas 'bab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnyog pa med ces bya ba ni phan tshun brgyud pas khams rnams ma 'dres pa'i phyir dang / rlung gi rgyu ba yang dus bzang po'i rigs pas 'bab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Unpolluted” is because the elements are not mixed by mutual transmission, and because the movement of the winds is regular by the reasoning of good time.

original: phung po khams sogs tshogs la khyab //
analyzed: phung po khams sogs tshogs la khyab //
translated: The aggregates, elements, etc. are pervaded by the assembly.

original: ces bya ba ni phal cher de'i bdag nyid can gyi lus pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni phal cher de'i bdag nyid can gyi lus pa'o //
translated: This is the body which is for the most part of the nature of that.

original: mchog dang mchog rab ces bya ba ni gzhan du gyur pa'i rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi grangs can las so //
analyzed: mchog dang mchog rab ces bya ba ni gzhan du gyur pa'i rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi grangs can las so //
translated: The supreme and the most supreme are the seventy-two thousand transformed channels.

original: mchog ces bya ba ni rtsa gsum gyi ngo bo nyid kyi mchog tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mchog ces bya ba ni rtsa gsum gyi ngo bo nyid kyi mchog tu gyur pa'o //
translated: The supreme is the supreme nature of the three channels.

original: de ltar don rnam pa gsum gyis mtshams kyi rtsa gsum rgyas par bshad pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar don rnam pa gsum gyis mtshams kyi rtsa gsum rgyas par bshad pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the three channels of the junctures with three topics,

original: de ni de'i rnam par dag pa brjod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ni de'i rnam par dag pa brjod pa'i phyir //
translated: now, in order to express their purity,

original: de'i yan lag rang gi ngo bo ni /
analyzed: de'i yan lag rang gi ngo bo ni /
translated: the nature of their branches is stated:

original: rnam par thar ba'i sgo gsum dngos //
analyzed: rnam par thar ba'i sgo gsum dngos //
translated: The three doors of liberation are the realities.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: And so forth.

original: de ma thag par bstan pa'i rtsa gsum po stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med @188b pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de ma thag par bstan pa'i rtsa gsum po stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med @188b pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The three channels just explained are the nature of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: rtsa gsum pa'i ngo bo la dmigs nas rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsa gsum pa'i ngo bo la dmigs nas rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the three doors of liberation are accomplished by observing the nature of the third channel.

original: de kho na nyid gsum sdom pa //
analyzed: de kho na nyid gsum sdom pa //
translated: The three realities are summarized.

original: zhes bya ba la de kho na nyid gsum gyi gnas kyi go 'phang ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la de kho na nyid gsum gyi gnas kyi go 'phang ni /
translated: The state of the three realities is

original: bsdus pa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i ngo bo ste /
translated: the summarized essence,

original: bdag dang sngags dang ye shes kyi de kho na nyid kyi phyir dang sku la sogs pa de kho na nyid gsum gyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang sngags dang ye shes kyi de kho na nyid kyi phyir dang sku la sogs pa de kho na nyid gsum gyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because of the reality of self, mantra, and intuition, and because of the nature of the three realities of body, etc.

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dbye ba gsum //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dbye ba gsum //
translated: Desire, hatred, and delusion are the three divisions of intrinsic reality.

original: zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dang bcas pa rnam par ma dag pa'i shes pa gsum gyis 'gag pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽mtshams kyang ni zhes bya ba ni mtshan mo dang nyin mo dang / mtshams kyi dbye bas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dang bcas pa rnam par ma dag pa'i shes pa gsum gyis 'gag pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro // mtshams kyang ni zhes bya ba ni mtshan mo dang nyin mo dang / mtshams kyi dbye bas so //
translated: This is because of the nature of the cessation of the three impure consciousnesses with their intrinsic natures.🔽The three divisions of day, night, and twilight

original: dam tshig mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum //
analyzed: dam tshig mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum //
translated: are the three divisions of the three commitments.

original: zhes bya ba ni dus kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dus kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: This is the reality of time.

original: mtshams la sogs pa rnams ji ltar rigs par snang ba la sogs pa ye shes gsum gyi ngo bor shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshams la sogs pa rnams ji ltar rigs par snang ba la sogs pa ye shes gsum gyi ngo bor shes par bya'o //
translated: The limits and so on should be known as the nature of the three intuitions, such as the appearance and so on, as is appropriate.

original: sangs rgyas dam chos dge 'dun ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dam chos dge 'dun ni //
translated: The Buddha, the True Dharma, and the Community🔽are the characteristics of the three vows.

original: zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i gnyid las sad pa'i phyir dang / blo kha 'byed pa'i phyir dang / chos rnams thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pas sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i gnyid las sad pa'i phyir dang / blo kha 'byed pa'i phyir dang / chos rnams thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pas sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Buddha is so called because he has awakened from the sleep of nescience, because he has opened his mind, and because he has realized all things as they are.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin par byed pas na chos so //🔽dam pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi chos te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin par byed pas na chos so // dam pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi chos te /
translated: The Dharma is so called because it holds its own characteristics.

original: dam pa'i chos so //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos so //
translated: The True Dharma is the Dharma of the Noble Ones.

original: dge 'dun ni gang zag zung bzhi la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis sdud pa'i rnam pa can nyid kyi phyir dge 'dun no //
analyzed: dge 'dun ni gang zag zung bzhi la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis sdud pa'i rnam pa can nyid kyi phyir dge 'dun no //
translated: The Community is so called because it is the nature of the four pairs of persons and so on, and because it has the aspect of gathering.

original: sdom pa gsum gyi mtshan nyid do /
analyzed: sdom pa gsum gyi mtshan nyid do /
translated: This is the characteristic of the three vows.

original: zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la sdom pa'i mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la sdom pa'i mtshan nyid de //
translated: The characteristic of the vow of the Tathagata lineage is

original: de yongs su mdor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yongs su mdor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of its completion.

original: stong nyid ye shes rdo rje ni /
analyzed: stong nyid ye shes rdo rje ni /
translated: The vajra of intuition of emptiness

original: zhes bya ba ni shes pa dang shes byas bsdus pa'i chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni shes pa dang shes byas bsdus pa'i chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid do //
translated: This is the emptiness of all phenomena included in the knower and the known.

original: ye shes zhes bya ba ni ngo bo de nyid kyis stong pa nyid yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes zhes bya ba ni ngo bo de nyid kyis stong pa nyid yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Wisdom is the thorough knowledge of that very nature of emptiness.

original: rdo rje zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las rgyal bas bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las rgyal bas bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Vajra is taught because of victory over the adverse side.

original: gsum gyi de nyid mtshan nyid do//
analyzed: gsum gyi de nyid mtshan nyid do//
translated: The reality of the three is the characteristic.

original: zhes bya ba ni rtsa gsum gyi ngo bo'i de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtsa gsum gyi ngo bo'i de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the characteristic of the reality of the nature of the three channels.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyer mkho ni //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyer mkho ni //
translated: The cause and effect are the benefit.

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan la phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i ngo bos rnal 'byor gsum gyi rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid de /🔽de la 'bras bu ni zung du 'jug pa'i @189a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan la phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i ngo bos rnal 'byor gsum gyi rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid de / de la 'bras bu ni zung du 'jug pa'i @189a * //
translated: This is the characteristic of the purity of the three yogas by the nature of the perfection of the benefit of cause and effect for others.

original: rnam pa'o // rgyu ni bskyed pa'i rim pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa'o // rgyu ni bskyed pa'i rim pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therein, the effect is the aspect of union. The cause is the creation stage, and so on.

original: de dag gis lhun gyis grub pa'i sems can gyi don du gzhan la phan pa'i phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gis lhun gyis grub pa'i sems can gyi don du gzhan la phan pa'i phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: They are the perfection of benefit for others for the sake of spontaneously present sentient beings.

original: de rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: That is the characteristic of their purity.

original: rlung dang mkhris pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: rlung dang mkhris pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The words wind, bile, etc.

original: mdo ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mdo ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: are just as in the sutra.

original: khams btus pa zhes bya ba ni khams thams cad bsdus pa'i don gyis so //
