translated: Vajra repetition is the repetition of the indivisible, free from the characteristics of external repetition.

original: mchog ces bya ba ni sems rtse gcig pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog ces bya ba ni sems rtse gcig pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “supreme” is because it is the cause of the one-pointed mind.

original: rim zhes bya ba ni rim gyis 'jug pa la slob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim zhes bya ba ni rim gyis 'jug pa la slob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “stage” is because it is the training in the gradual engagement.

original: de ltar de'i che ba'i bdag nyid bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar de'i che ba'i bdag nyid bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught its greatness,

original: da ni de'i 'bras bu brjod pa'i rim bzhin zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du'o //
analyzed: da ni de'i 'bras bu brjod pa'i rim bzhin zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du'o //
translated: now, in order to teach its result, [the Bhagavān] declares, “in due order.”

original: de yis zhes bya ba ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i bsgoms pas so //
analyzed: de yis zhes bya ba ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i bsgoms pas so //
translated: “By that” means by the meditation of vajra repetition.

original: yongs su shes zhes bya ba ni ma ning bzlas pa'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: yongs su shes zhes bya ba ni ma ning bzlas pa'i rnam pas so //
translated: “One should know” means by the method of neuter repetition.

original: thob 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yang dag par thob pa'o //
analyzed: thob 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yang dag par thob pa'o //
translated: “One will attain” means one will truly attain.

original: the tshom med ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa nyid kyi the tshom med pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom med ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa nyid kyi the tshom med pa'o //
translated: “Without doubt” means without doubt because of the teaching of the Bhagavān.

original: rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud dpal rdo rje phreng ba'i rgya cher 'grel pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud dpal rdo rje phreng ba'i rgya cher 'grel pa /
translated: The Commentary on the Glorious Vajra-Garland Mahāyoga Tantra,

original: pandi ta aa lam ka la shas mdzad pa /
analyzed: pandi ta aa lam ka la shas mdzad pa /
translated: Composed by the Paṇḍita Alaṃkakalaśa,

original: zab mo'i don shin tu gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: zab mo'i don shin tu gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba las /
translated: Called “Illuminating the Profound Meaning,”

original: le'u sum cu rtsa lnga pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
analyzed: le'u sum cu rtsa lnga pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
translated: Chapter 35 is the extensive explanation.

original: // / de ltar le'u sum cu rtsa lnga pa /
analyzed: // / de ltar le'u sum cu rtsa lnga pa /
translated: Thus, chapter 35

original: rnam par rtog pa dang rlung gcod pa'i yul la dri ba'i lan bstan nas /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang rlung gcod pa'i yul la dri ba'i lan bstan nas /
translated: has explained the reply to the question about the object of the severance of conceptuality and vāyu.

original: da ni rnam pa med pa'i rlung gi mtshan nyid kyi yul la dri ba'i lan brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rnam pa med pa'i rlung gi mtshan nyid kyi yul la dri ba'i lan brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to express the reply to the question about the object of the characteristic of the non-aspect vāyu,

original: dang por re zhig de rtsom pa ni /
analyzed: dang por re zhig de rtsom pa ni /
translated: first, the composition is as follows.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Then,

original: sum cu rtsa lnga pa bshad pa'i rjes la'o //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa lnga pa bshad pa'i rjes la'o //
translated: after the explanation of chapter 35,

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du'o //
translated: “again” is as before.

original: rnam rtog med pa'i rlung shar ba //
analyzed: rnam rtog med pa'i rlung shar ba //
translated: The “arising of the nonconceptual vāyu”

original: zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //🔽rnam par rtog pa med pa ni //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang 'brel to // rnam par rtog pa med pa ni //
translated: is related.🔽Nonconceptuality

original: rnam rtog spangs pa de kho na nyid gang las 'byung ba de rnam rtog med par skye ba ste /
analyzed: rnam rtog spangs pa de kho na nyid gang las 'byung ba de rnam rtog med par skye ba ste /
translated: is the nonconceptual arising from the reality free from conceptuality.

original: mchog ces bya ba ni mchog tu rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rnam pa'i de kho na nyid mngon du byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog ces bya ba ni mchog tu rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rnam pa'i de kho na nyid mngon du byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The supreme is so called because it is the cause for realizing the reality whose aspect is the natural luminosity that is supreme.

original: des ci zhig byed ce na /
analyzed: des ci zhig byed ce na /
translated: What does it do?

original: de'i phyir gang zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “that which,”

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i de kho na nyid gang la'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i de kho na nyid gang la'o //
translated: in regard to the non-conceptual reality.

original: shes zhes bya ba ni thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i stobs kyis shin tu rtogs pa la ste /
analyzed: shes zhes bya ba ni thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i stobs kyis shin tu rtogs pa la ste /
translated: “ Knowledge” means thorough understanding by the power of hearing, reflection, and meditation.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' go 'phang thob //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' go 'phang thob //
translated: “ The stage of Vajrasattva”

original: ces bya ba dang 'brel to //🔽rdo rje sems dpa' ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'i bdag nyid can gyi rang gi ngo bo ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba dang 'brel to // rdo rje sems dpa' ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'i bdag nyid can gyi rang gi ngo bo ni /
translated: is connected.🔽Vajrasattva is the nature of the stage of union.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: His own nature is characterized by natural luminosity.

original: 'thob pa ni rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i @201a * //🔽don to // de ltar de rtsom pa bstan nas /
analyzed: 'thob pa ni rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i @201a * // don to // de ltar de rtsom pa bstan nas /
translated: “ Attainment” means “realization.”🔽Having thus taught the composition,🔽now, in order to explain the actual text,

original: da ni dngos su bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dngos su bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: he says,

original: de'i yan lag rnam rtog med pa'i rlung shar ba rang gi ngo bo bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i yan lag rnam rtog med pa'i rlung shar ba rang gi ngo bo bstan pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the nature of the arising of the nonconceptual🔽vāyu is the branch of that.🔽

original: rtogs pa med pa'i zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rtogs pa med pa'i zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The teaching of the nature of the arising of the non-conceptual wind, which is a branch of that, is stated by “without realization.🔽”

original: ma ning gi bzlas pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: ma ning gi bzlas pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The nature of the neuter repetition.

original: rlung chen po zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo rnyed pas so //🔽gnyis pa thams cad rnam par spangs //
analyzed: rlung chen po zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo rnyed pas so // gnyis pa thams cad rnam par spangs //
translated: “Great wind” is because of the attainment of its own nature.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam rtog gi rlung dang bral ba'i phyir ro //🔽dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin bdag //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam rtog gi rlung dang bral ba'i phyir ro // dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin bdag //
translated: “Having abandoned all duality” is because of being free from the conceptual wind.

original: ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang rlung la khyab par byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽bsgom dang bsgom min go 'phang bral //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang rlung la khyab par byed pa'i phyir ro // bsgom dang bsgom min go 'phang bral //
translated: “The nature of all things” is because of pervading conceptualization and the wind.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dug pa dang gnas ba ldang ba spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dug pa dang gnas ba ldang ba spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Free from the state of meditation and non-meditation” is because of abandoning sitting, remaining, and rising.

original: ye shes che zhes bya ba ni 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes che zhes bya ba ni 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: “Great intuition” is because of being the nature of clear light.

original: rnal 'byor chen po zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Great yoga” is because of being free from the yoga of the creation stage.

original: dpe med ces bya ba ni bag chags dang bral bas so //
analyzed: dpe med ces bya ba ni bag chags dang bral bas so //
translated: The “unimaginable” is because of being free from latent tendencies.

original: dri ma med pa dang zhes bya ba ni rigs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //🔽phra ba'i cha kun dbus na gnas //
analyzed: dri ma med pa dang zhes bya ba ni rigs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro // phra ba'i cha kun dbus na gnas //
translated: The “stainless” is because of being free from the afflictions of the rational mind.

original: zhes bya ba ni phra ba'i cha thams cad kyi mthar gnas pas na de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phra ba'i cha thams cad kyi mthar gnas pas na de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The “center of all subtle parts” is so called because it is located at the end of all subtle parts.

original: aa wa dh'u t'i'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽thig le n'a da rnam par spangs //
analyzed: aa wa dh'u t'i'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro // thig le n'a da rnam par spangs //
translated: This is because it is the essence of the avadhūtī.

original: zhes bya ba ni rlung dang chos kyi 'khor lor gnas pa'i thig le n'a da dag dang bral pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rlung dang chos kyi 'khor lor gnas pa'i thig le n'a da dag dang bral pa'o //
translated: The “bindu and nāda are abandoned” is being free from the bindu and nāda located in the dharmacakra and the navel.

original: kun la khyab cing zhes bya ba ni rtsa'i 'khor lo la khyab par byed pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: kun la khyab cing zhes bya ba ni rtsa'i 'khor lo la khyab par byed pa nyid kyis so //
translated: “Pervading all” is because it pervades the cakra of the nāḍīs.

original: zhi ba dang zhes bya ba ni de dang bral ba'i rnam rtog gis ma gos pa dang sems 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba dang zhes bya ba ni de dang bral ba'i rnam rtog gis ma gos pa dang sems 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: “Peace” is because it is uncontaminated by concepts that are free from that and because the mind is the essence of luminosity.

original: bdag byin gyis brlabs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag byin gyis brlabs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The characteristic of self-consecration is because of the nature of the illusion-like meditative concentration.

original: gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam spangs pa //
analyzed: gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam spangs pa //
translated: Free from the apprehended and apprehender

original: zhes bya ba ni ril por 'dzin pa dang rjes su gzhig pa'i rim pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa mi snang bar byed pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ril por 'dzin pa dang rjes su gzhig pa'i rim pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa mi snang bar byed pas so //
translated: is because of the non-appearance of the apprehended and apprehender by way of the process of total apprehension and subsequent destruction.

original: bag chags rnam rtog rnam par spangs //
analyzed: bag chags rnam rtog rnam par spangs //
translated: Free from the concepts of habitual tendencies

original: zhes bya ba ni phra ba'i rang bzhin bzlog pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phra ba'i rang bzhin bzlog pa'i phyir ro /
translated: is because of the reversal of the subtle nature.🔽The knot of the channels

original: tshigs mdud pa las zhes bya ba ni rtsa'i mdud pa'o //
analyzed: tshigs mdud pa las zhes bya ba ni rtsa'i mdud pa'o //
translated: is the knot of the channel.🔽Empty of the part

original: cha yis stong zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems kyi cha yis so //
analyzed: cha yis stong zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems kyi cha yis so //
translated: is empty of the part of the bodhicitta.🔽Meditation

original: bsgom dang zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i ngo bo mngon du byed pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: bsgom dang zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i ngo bo mngon du byed pa'i thabs so //
translated: is the method of manifesting the essence of the connate.🔽The object of meditation

original: bsgom bya zhes bya ba ni dpe'i lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom bya zhes bya ba ni dpe'i lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: is the example connate.🔽Abandonment

original: rnam par spangs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par bral ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par spangs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par bral ba'o //
translated: is separation.

original: tshigs dang mdud pa dang cha dang lam @201b dang bsgom pa dang bsgom bya ni /
analyzed: tshigs dang mdud pa dang cha dang lam @201b dang bsgom pa dang bsgom bya ni /
translated: The joints, knots, parts, path, meditation, and object of meditation are

original: tshigs mdud pa la cha yi lam //🔽sgom dang bsgom bya rnam par spangs //
analyzed: tshigs mdud pa la cha yi lam // sgom dang bsgom bya rnam par spangs //
translated: The joints, knots, parts, path,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Meditation, and object of meditation are abandoned.

original: thig le n'a da rnam par spangs //
analyzed: thig le n'a da rnam par spangs //
translated: The bindu and nada are abandoned.

original: zhes bya ba la thig le ni byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la thig le ni byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le'o //
translated: The bindu is the bindu of bodhicitta.

original: n'a da ni de'i dus la bab pa'i bde ba chen po'i sgra'o //
analyzed: n'a da ni de'i dus la bab pa'i bde ba chen po'i sgra'o //
translated: Nada is the sound of great bliss that arises at that time.

original: go 'phang ni rten no //
analyzed: go 'phang ni rten no //
translated: The stage is the support.

original: de rnams 'das pa ni rnam par spangs pa te /🔽thabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams 'das pa ni rnam par spangs pa te / thabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The abandonment of those is the method.

original: thabs kyang gzings dang 'dra ba nyid kyis dor bya'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs kyang gzings dang 'dra ba nyid kyis dor bya'i phyir ro //
translated: The method is like a raft, because it is to be abandoned.

original: stong nyid ye shes mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: stong nyid ye shes mtshan nyid do //
translated: The nature of emptiness is wisdom.

original: zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid chen po bco brgyad kyi bdag nyid can gyi 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid yongs su shes pa'i rang bzhin can ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid chen po bco brgyad kyi bdag nyid can gyi 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid yongs su shes pa'i rang bzhin can ni /
translated: The nature of the reality of luminosity, which is the nature of the eighteen great emptinesses, is the nature of the knowledge of emptiness.

original: sngags dang phyag rgya zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgya zhes bya ba la /
translated: The mantra and the mudra are

original: sngags ni bskyed pa'i sa bon la sogs pa 'am snying po dang / nye ba'i snying po'o //
analyzed: sngags ni bskyed pa'i sa bon la sogs pa 'am snying po dang / nye ba'i snying po'o //
translated: Mantra is the seed of generation and so forth, or the essence and the close essence.

original: phyag rgya ni lag pa'i phyag rgya 'am /
analyzed: phyag rgya ni lag pa'i phyag rgya 'am /
translated: Mudra is the hand mudra,

original: dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //🔽de bzhin rnam pa zhes bya ba ni de dag gis bsgrub pa'i rnam pa ni /
analyzed: dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o // de bzhin rnam pa zhes bya ba ni de dag gis bsgrub pa'i rnam pa ni /
translated: or the pledge mudra.

original: lha'i gzugs kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: lha'i gzugs kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Thus, the aspect is the characteristic of the form of the deity.

original: de'i ngo bo'i cha ni rnam par rtog pa bskyed pa'i rim pa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo'i cha ni rnam par rtog pa bskyed pa'i rim pa'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The nature of that is the nature of the stage of generation that produces discursive thought.

original: de'i dbye ba rnam par spangs pa ni /
analyzed: de'i dbye ba rnam par spangs pa ni /
translated: The abandonment of the division of that

original: de dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de dang bral ba'o //
translated: is free from that.

original: de ltar rnam rtog med pa'i rlung 'char ba'i ngo bo bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rnam rtog med pa'i rlung 'char ba'i ngo bo bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the nature of the arising of the nonconceptual vāyu,

original: da ni de nyid la rgyud gzhan lam bstan pa'i rim pas thabs brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de nyid la rgyud gzhan lam bstan pa'i rim pas thabs brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to explain the method in that, in the stage of the path of the other tantras,

original: bya ba spyod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bya ba spyod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “the conduct tantra,” and so on.

original: lan gsum du khrus dang gos lan gsum du brje ba bstan pa gtso bor gyur pa'i bya ba'i rgyud las so //
analyzed: lan gsum du khrus dang gos lan gsum du brje ba bstan pa gtso bor gyur pa'i bya ba'i rgyud las so //
translated: The conduct tantra is the principal teaching of washing three times and changing one’s clothes three times.

original: brdungs pa dang lugs su blugs pa'i zhal dang phyag la sogs pa 'dzin pas rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i ngo bo 'dzin pa ston par byed ba ni spyod pa'i rgyud do //
analyzed: brdungs pa dang lugs su blugs pa'i zhal dang phyag la sogs pa 'dzin pas rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i ngo bo 'dzin pa ston par byed ba ni spyod pa'i rgyud do //
translated: The practice tantra teaches the nature of Vajrasattva and so forth by holding the faces, hands, and so forth that are beaten and poured into a mold.

original: zhal gsum phyag drug la sogs pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa'i gzugs grub pa ston par byed pa ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud do //
analyzed: zhal gsum phyag drug la sogs pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa'i gzugs grub pa ston par byed pa ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud do //
translated: The yoga tantra teaches the accomplishment of the form of a universal monarch and so forth by holding the form of three faces, six hands, and so forth.

original: rgyud rnams la yang ma gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyud rnams la yang ma gsungs so //
translated: It is not taught in the tantras.

original: zhes bya ba ni de lta bu la mos pa'i sems can rnams la de'i yul la mi mos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de lta bu la mos pa'i sems can rnams la de'i yul la mi mos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because beings who aspire to such a deity do not aspire to its domain.

original: rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud chen po //
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud chen po //
translated: The great yoga tantra

original: zhes bya ba ni rim pa gnyis ston par mdzad pa'i dpal gsang ba 'dus pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rim pa gnyis ston par mdzad pa'i dpal gsang ba 'dus pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: is the glorious Guhyasamaja and so forth, which teach the two stages.

original: bshad par bya zhes bya ba ni brjod pa'o //
analyzed: bshad par bya zhes bya ba ni brjod pa'o //
translated: It is said to be explained means it is expressed.

original: dam tshig ces bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa rang gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: dam tshig ces bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa rang gi ngo bo'o //
translated: Samaya means the nonconceptual nature.

original: mchog ces bya ba ni mchog gi skyes bu'i don to //
analyzed: mchog ces bya ba ni mchog gi skyes bu'i don to //
translated: The supreme is the meaning of the supreme person.

original: thog ma nyid du @202a * //
analyzed: thog ma nyid du @202a * //
translated: First of all,

original: bshad par rigs //
analyzed: bshad par rigs //
translated: it is proper to explain.

original: zhes bya ba ni rtsa dbus mar 'jug pa'i dus su h'um yig bzlas pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtsa dbus mar 'jug pa'i dus su h'um yig bzlas pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the characteristic of the recitation of the syllable hūṃ at the time of entering into the central channel.

original: man ngag gi rim pa mi 'dor bas so //
analyzed: man ngag gi rim pa mi 'dor bas so //
translated: Because of not abandoning the stage of the esoteric instructions.

original: ji bzhin cho ga zhes bya ba ni rgya cher le'u nyi shu rtsa gnyis par bstan pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: ji bzhin cho ga zhes bya ba ni rgya cher le'u nyi shu rtsa gnyis par bstan pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: Just as the rite means the rite taught in the twenty-second chapter.

original: de ltar de nyid la rgyud gzhan rnams la bstan pa'i rim pas thabs bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar de nyid la rgyud gzhan rnams la bstan pa'i rim pas thabs bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the method by the stage taught in other tantras with regard to that reality,

original: da ni de nyid la bla ma'i gdams ngag gis thob par bya ba brjod pa'i phyir /🔽de nyid rig pa'i rjes 'gro shes //
analyzed: da ni de nyid la bla ma'i gdams ngag gis thob par bya ba brjod pa'i phyir / de nyid rig pa'i rjes 'gro shes //
translated: now, in order to state what is to be attained with regard to that reality by means of the guru’s instruction,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says, following the knowledge of reality, one should know.

original: sngar bstan pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i rim pas so //
translated: By the stage taught previously.

original: shes zhes bya ba ni shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes zhes bya ba ni shes par bya ba'o //
translated: One should know means one should understand.

original: bla ma brgyud pas shes zhes bya ba ni rdo rje slob dpon gyi zhal las so ;
analyzed: bla ma brgyud pas shes zhes bya ba ni rdo rje slob dpon gyi zhal las so ;
translated: One should know from the guru lineage means from the mouth of the vajra master.

original: / go 'phang mchog ces bya ba ni mchog gi go 'phang thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: / go 'phang mchog ces bya ba ni mchog gi go 'phang thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: The “supreme state” is the cause for attaining the supreme state.

original: rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud dpal rdo rje phreng ba'i rgya cher 'grel pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud dpal rdo rje phreng ba'i rgya cher 'grel pa /
translated: The Commentary on the Glorious Vajra Garland, a Mahāyoga Tantra,

original: pandi ta aa lam ka ka la shas mdzad pa /
analyzed: pandi ta aa lam ka ka la shas mdzad pa /
translated: Composed by the Paṇḍita Alaṃkakalaśa

original: zab mo'i don shin tu gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: zab mo'i don shin tu gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba las /
translated: From the “Illuminating the Profound Meaning”

original: le'u sum cu rtsa drug pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o //
analyzed: le'u sum cu rtsa drug pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o //
translated: The Extensive Explanation of the Thirty-Sixth Chapter

original: / de ltar le'u sum cu rtsa drug pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i rlung gi mtshan nyid kyi yul la dri ba'i lan bstan nas /
analyzed: / de ltar le'u sum cu rtsa drug pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i rlung gi mtshan nyid kyi yul la dri ba'i lan bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the reply to the question about the object of the nonconceptual wind,

original: da ni rtsa rnams nub pa'i rnal 'byor gyi yul la dri ba'i lan brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rtsa rnams nub pa'i rnal 'byor gyi yul la dri ba'i lan brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to explain the reply to the question about the object of the yoga of the dissolution of the nāḍīs,

original: le'u sum cu rtsa bdun pa nye bar 'god cing /
analyzed: le'u sum cu rtsa bdun pa nye bar 'god cing /
translated: the thirty-seventh chapter is set forth.

original: dang por re zhig de'i rtsom pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dang por re zhig de'i rtsom pa bstan pa ni /
translated: First, the composition is explained:

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Then, etc.

original: le'u sum cu rtsa drug pa bshad pa'i rjes la'o //
analyzed: le'u sum cu rtsa drug pa bshad pa'i rjes la'o //
translated: After the explanation of the thirty-sixth chapter,

original: bcom ldan rdo rje zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa drug pa rdo rje 'chang gi rnam pa'o //🔽rtsa rnams nub pa'i rnal 'byor ni //
analyzed: bcom ldan rdo rje zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa drug pa rdo rje 'chang gi rnam pa'o // rtsa rnams nub pa'i rnal 'byor ni //
translated: The Blessed One, Vajra, is the form of the sixth Tathāgata, Vajradhara.🔽The yoga of the channels’ disappearance

original: yang dag sbyor ba bshad kyis nyon //
analyzed: yang dag sbyor ba bshad kyis nyon //
translated: is the right union. Listen!

original: zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: This is connected.

original: de kho na nyid ces bya ba ni don dam par ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ces bya ba ni don dam par ro //
translated: Reality means ultimately.

original: rdo rje can ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rdo rje can ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is he like, the vajra-holder?🔽Therefore,

original: de'i phyir / the tshom thams cad gcod pa po //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir / the tshom thams cad gcod pa po // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: he is the one who cuts through all doubts.

original: the tshom thams cad zlog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom thams cad zlog par byed pa'o //
translated: He turns away all doubts.

original: nyon zhes bya ba ni phyag na rdo rje nyan pa la sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: nyon zhes bya ba ni phyag na rdo rje nyan pa la sbyar ba'o //
translated: Listen means that Vajrapāṇi is connected to the listener.

original: de ltar de rtsom pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar de rtsom pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the composition,

original: da ni dngos su bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dngos su bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to explain the actual text,

original: de'i yan lag rtsa rnams kyi bskyed pa rjes su 'gro ba'i rim pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i yan lag rtsa rnams kyi bskyed pa rjes su 'gro ba'i rim pa bstan pa ni /
translated: the limbs of that, the teaching of the sequence of the generation of the channels,

original: yul dang dbang po yang dag sbyor //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: yul dang dbang po yang dag sbyor // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: is the right union of the sense faculties and objects.

original: dmigs pa dang bdag po'i rkyen dang 'brel pa las so //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bdag po'i rkyen dang 'brel pa las so //
translated: From the connection of the objective condition and the dominant condition.

original: rtsa rnams zhes bya ba ni rig pa'i rang bzhin 'khor lo bzhir gtogs pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: rtsa rnams zhes bya ba ni rig pa'i rang bzhin 'khor lo bzhir gtogs pa rnams la'o //
translated: The “channels” are those belonging to the four cakras, which are the nature of the knowledge.

original: 'char bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rab tu sad pa las so //
analyzed: 'char bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rab tu sad pa las so //
translated: “Arising” means from the arousing.

original: @202b 'char nas sngon bzhin zhes bya ba ni yid la byed pa dang rlung dang yang dag par sbyor ba las skyes pa ni /
analyzed: @202b 'char nas sngon bzhin zhes bya ba ni yid la byed pa dang rlung dang yang dag par sbyor ba las skyes pa ni /
translated: “Having arisen, as before” means that the one arisen from the union of the mind, the wind, and the real is the arousing.

original: rab tu sad par gyur nas so //
analyzed: rab tu sad par gyur nas so //
translated: “Having arisen” means having been aroused.

original: skye ba'i rim pa bla na med //
analyzed: skye ba'i rim pa bla na med //
translated: The unsurpassed process of generation

original: ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: is to be supplied.

original: de nas gzhan pa bskyed pa'i nus pa'i ngo bo 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas gzhan pa bskyed pa'i nus pa'i ngo bo 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then the nature of the ability to generate the other arises.

original: bla na med ces bya ba ni 'khor ba'i chos la 'jug pa'i gong na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bla na med ces bya ba ni 'khor ba'i chos la 'jug pa'i gong na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Unsurpassed” means that there is nothing higher than the engagement of the phenomena of cyclic existence.

original: kun rtog skye ba zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis tshogs bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: kun rtog skye ba zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis tshogs bskyed pa'o //
translated: “The arising of the imagination” means the generation of the natural assembly.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i rim pa dbang po dang yul yang dag par sbyor pa'i ngo bos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i rim pa dbang po dang yul yang dag par sbyor pa'i ngo bos so //
translated: “Therefore” means because of the process of generation, the nature of the union of the sense powers and the objects.

original: de nyid kyi phyir brgya dang brgyad kyis zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir brgya dang brgyad kyis zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “by one hundred and eight.🔽”

original: le'u gsum pa gsungs pa'i cho gas so //
analyzed: le'u gsum pa gsungs pa'i cho gas so //
translated: By the rite taught in the third chapter.🔽“

original: rim zhes bya ba ni rim pa ji lta bar zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rim zhes bya ba ni rim pa ji lta bar zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In order” means in accordance with the sequence.

original: de las byung ba'i las kyi stobs kyis zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i las kyi stobs kyis zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the phrase “by the power of the karma that arises from that” is as follows.🔽“

original: de las skye dang zhes bya ba ni brgya dang brgyad kyi rang bzhin gyi tshogs las dang bcas pa las so //
analyzed: de las skye dang zhes bya ba ni brgya dang brgyad kyi rang bzhin gyi tshogs las dang bcas pa las so //
translated: Arising from that” means from the collection of one hundred and eight natures together with karma.🔽“

original: skye dang zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba drug gi 'khor ba pa'o /
analyzed: skye dang zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba drug gi 'khor ba pa'o /
translated: Arising” means the transmigrator in the six realms of existence.🔽“

original: na rga zhes bya ba ni phung po yongs su smin pa dang / nad rnams la skye ba sngon du 'gro ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: na rga zhes bya ba ni phung po yongs su smin pa dang / nad rnams la skye ba sngon du 'gro ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Sickness and old age” means the ripening of the aggregates, because sickness is preceded by birth.🔽“

original: 'chi ba zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'o //
translated: Death” means dying.🔽“

original: slar yang ldog par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni slar yang srid pa gzhan du skye ba 'dzin par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: slar yang ldog par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni slar yang srid pa gzhan du skye ba 'dzin par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Again and again” means that one takes birth again and again in another existence.

original: de ltar rtsa rnams bskyed pa'i yul la rjes su 'gro ba bsten nas /
analyzed: de ltar rtsa rnams bskyed pa'i yul la rjes su 'gro ba bsten nas /
translated: Thus, having relied on the process of the generation of the channels,

original: da ni ldog pa'i rim pa brjod pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: da ni ldog pa'i rim pa brjod pa'i phyir ;
translated: now, in order to explain the process of their reversal,

original: yul rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: yul rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “the objects,” etc.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'o //🔽yul rnams dngos po med pa yis //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'o // yul rnams dngos po med pa yis //
translated: Blue, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni don dam par rang bzhin gyis dben pa yang dag par shes pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don dam par rang bzhin gyis dben pa yang dag par shes pas so //
translated: “By the non-existence of the objects” means by the correct knowledge of the ultimate, which is the absence of intrinsic reality.

original: de nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni gcig dang du ma la sogs pa'i rigs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni gcig dang du ma la sogs pa'i rigs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: “By that very,” etc. means by the reasonings of one and many, etc.

original: dpyod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par dpyod pa'o //
translated: “By analysis” means by thorough analysis.

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba ni dus gang gi tshe'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba ni dus gang gi tshe'o //
translated: “When,” etc. means at whatever time.

original: de las shes zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i yul rnams la'o //
analyzed: de las shes zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i yul rnams la'o //
translated: “From that,” etc. means from the objects such as blue, etc.

original: de tshe zhes bya ba ni don dam pa la tshe'o //
analyzed: de tshe zhes bya ba ni don dam pa la tshe'o //
translated: “At that time,” etc. means at the time of the ultimate.

original: dngos med shes zhes bya ba ni rang gi med par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos med shes zhes bya ba ni rang gi med par shes pa yin no //
translated: “The knowledge of non-existence” means the knowledge of one’s own non-existence.

original: yul rnams med pa yi zhes bya ba ni de ma thag par bstan pa'i rnam par dpyad pas so //
analyzed: yul rnams med pa yi zhes bya ba ni de ma thag par bstan pa'i rnam par dpyad pas so //
translated: “The nonexistence of objects” refers to the analysis just explained.

original: dngos su zhes bya ba ni mngon sum nyid du'o //
analyzed: dngos su zhes bya ba ni mngon sum nyid du'o //
translated: “In reality” means in actuality.

original: dbang po rnams ni zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa drug pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa drug pa'o //
translated: “The faculties” refers to the six faculties, such as the eyes.

original: skye ba min zhes bya ba ni dngos med ni skye ba med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skye ba min zhes bya ba ni dngos med ni skye ba med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Do not arise” means that nonentities are said to be nonarisen.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni de'i rjes nyid la'o //🔽gnyis @203a * //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni de'i rjes nyid la'o // gnyis @203a * //
translated: “Then” means immediately after that.

original: gnyis yang dag sbyor zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang yul yang dag par sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid can la'o //
analyzed: gnyis yang dag sbyor zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang yul yang dag par sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid can la'o //
translated: “The union of the two” refers to the characteristic of the union of the faculties and objects.

original: dngos dang zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin la'o //
analyzed: dngos dang zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin la'o //
translated: “In reality” means in nature.

original: dngos med stong nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i phyir khyad par du gtso bo de gnyis la stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos med stong nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i phyir khyad par du gtso bo de gnyis la stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: “The emptiness of nonentities” means that the emptiness of the two principal ones is distinguished by the fact that they are nonentities.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang yul yang dag par sbyor ba med pas so //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang yul yang dag par sbyor ba med pas so //
translated: “Then” means because there is no union of the faculties and objects.

original: rtsa rnams zhes bya ba ni rtsa rnams la'o //
analyzed: rtsa rnams zhes bya ba ni rtsa rnams la'o //
translated: The “channels” are the channels.🔽“

original: nub 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni mi 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nub 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni mi 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They will disappear” means they will not be interrupted.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /🔽de'i phyir / 'khor lo'i rim pa la ni brten //
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na / de'i phyir / 'khor lo'i rim pa la ni brten //
translated: How so?🔽Therefore, it says:

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽sprul ba'i 'khor lo'i rim pas gnas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te / sprul ba'i 'khor lo'i rim pas gnas /
translated: “Based on the stages of the cakras.”

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are located by the stages of the emanation cakra.🔽“

original: de rnams shes zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo bzhi po'i rtsa rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams shes zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo bzhi po'i rtsa rnams so //
translated: Those” refers to the channels of the four cakras.🔽“

original: nub pa las ni zhes bya ba ni mi 'char bas so //
analyzed: nub pa las ni zhes bya ba ni mi 'char bas so //
translated: From their disappearance” means from their non-arising.🔽“

original: zhi zhes bya ba ni sad pa med pa'o //🔽stong phrag bdun cu rtsa brgyad ni //
analyzed: zhi zhes bya ba ni sad pa med pa'o // stong phrag bdun cu rtsa brgyad ni //
translated: Pacification” means the absence of awakening.🔽“

original: zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo bzhir gtogs pa'i rtsa rnams kyi bdag po'i dbang gis de rnams yang dag par bskyed pa'o //🔽kun kyang rtsa yi 'khor los sgyur //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo bzhir gtogs pa'i rtsa rnams kyi bdag po'i dbang gis de rnams yang dag par bskyed pa'o // kun kyang rtsa yi 'khor los sgyur //
translated: The seventy-two thousand” are the channels belonging to the four cakras, which are generated by the power of their lords.🔽“

original: zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems kyi cha la khyab par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems kyi cha la khyab par byed pa'o //
translated: All of them are channel-cakra rulers” means they pervade the portion of bodhicitta.

original: de ltar rjes su ldog pa'i rim pa bstan nas da ni de rnams kyi 'char ba'i rgyu'i yul la rnam par dpyod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar rjes su ldog pa'i rim pa bstan nas da ni de rnams kyi 'char ba'i rgyu'i yul la rnam par dpyod pa'i phyir /
translated: Having thus taught the sequence of the reversal, now, in order to analyze the objects that are the cause of their arising,🔽he says,

original: stong nyid rnal 'byor bsgoms pa las //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: stong nyid rnal 'byor bsgoms pa las // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: From the cultivation of the yoga of emptiness,

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa'i mtshan nyid bsgom pa'i sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa'i mtshan nyid bsgom pa'i sbyor ba ni /
translated: The cultivation of the yoga of the characteristic of the absence of intrinsic reality of all phenomena

original: goms pa'i sbyor bas so //
analyzed: goms pa'i sbyor bas so //
translated: is the cultivation of the yoga of familiarity.

original: yul rnams kyi ni zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: yul rnams kyi ni zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams la'o //
translated: With regard to the objects, that is, forms and so on,

original: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa ma bcos pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa ma bcos pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: the essence is the unfabricated essence that is connate.

original: shes pa zhes bya ba ni shes par byed pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa zhes bya ba ni shes par byed pa'o //
translated: Knowledge is that which causes understanding.

original: nges pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni rnam pa 'dis nges pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni rnam pa 'dis nges pa'o //
translated: Certainly is in this way.

original: rigs pa rdo rje zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la sogs pa gtan tshigs chen po lnga'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: rigs pa rdo rje zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la sogs pa gtan tshigs chen po lnga'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The reasoning diamond is the essence of the five great reasonings, such as dependent arising.

original: rdo rje ltar 'jig tshogs la lta ba thams cad ri'i rtse mo ltar 'joms pa ni /
analyzed: rdo rje ltar 'jig tshogs la lta ba thams cad ri'i rtse mo ltar 'joms pa ni /
translated: The diamond that destroys all views of the transitory collection, like the peak of a mountain,🔽is the view of the transitory collection.

original: rnam par nye bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par nye bar byed pa ni /
translated: The one that causes thorough affliction

original: dngos po la mngon bar zhen pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po la mngon bar zhen pa'o //
translated: is the manifest clinging to things.

original: 'joms par byed pa ni zlog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'joms par byed pa ni zlog par byed pa'o //
translated: The one that causes destruction is the one that causes reversal.🔽The extensive commentary on the glorious Vajra Garland

original: rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud dpal rdo rje phreng ba'i rgya cher 'grel pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud dpal rdo rje phreng ba'i rgya cher 'grel pa /
translated: tantra of the great yoga

original: pandi ta aa lam ka ka la shas mdzad pa /
analyzed: pandi ta aa lam ka ka la shas mdzad pa /
translated: composed by the paṇḍita Alaṃkakalaśa

original: zab mo'i don shin tu gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: zab mo'i don shin tu gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba las /
translated: called Clarifying the Profound Meaning

original: le'u sum cu rtsa bdun pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
analyzed: le'u sum cu rtsa bdun pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
translated: is the extensive explanation of the thirty-seventh chapter.

original: // / de ltar le'u sum cu rtsa @203b bdun pas rtsa rnams nub pa'i yul la dri ba'i lan bstan nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar le'u sum cu rtsa @203b bdun pas rtsa rnams nub pa'i yul la dri ba'i lan bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the reply to the question about the place where the nāḍīs disappear in the thirty-seventh chapter,

original: da ni 'khor lo drug gi sbyor ba'i bsgom pa'i yul la dri ba'i lan brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni 'khor lo drug gi sbyor ba'i bsgom pa'i yul la dri ba'i lan brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to explain the reply to the question about the object of meditation of the yoga of the six cakras,

original: le'u sum cu rtsa brgyad pa nye bar ston cing /
analyzed: le'u sum cu rtsa brgyad pa nye bar ston cing /
translated: the thirty-eighth chapter is presented.

original: dang por re zhig de'i rtsom pa ni /
analyzed: dang por re zhig de'i rtsom pa ni /
translated: First, the composition is as follows:

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Then, etc.

original: le'u sum cu rtsa bdun pa bshad pa'i rjes la'o //
analyzed: le'u sum cu rtsa bdun pa bshad pa'i rjes la'o //
translated: After the explanation of the thirty-seventh chapter.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du'o //
translated: Moreover, as before.

original: sbyor drug go 'phang mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sbyor drug go 'phang mtshan nyid do //
translated: The state of the six applications is the characteristic.

original: zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: This is connected.

original: sbyor ba drug gi go 'phang dang // 'khor lo rnams kyi ngo bo'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba drug gi go 'phang dang // 'khor lo rnams kyi ngo bo'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The state of the six applications and the nature of the wheels is

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bos rnam par bshad kyis zhes bya ba ste bshad kyis nyon zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bos rnam par bshad kyis zhes bya ba ste bshad kyis nyon zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: explained by the unmistaken nature. This is connected with listen.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: de'i phyir ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said just as it is.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bos so //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bos so //
translated: By the unmistaken nature.

original: ji ltar sbyor zhes bya ba ni go rims yongs su spangs pas so //🔽ji ltar 'dod pa'i yan lag rten //
analyzed: ji ltar sbyor zhes bya ba ni go rims yongs su spangs pas so // ji ltar 'dod pa'i yan lag rten //
translated: How is it applied? By abandoning the order.🔽The limbs are supported as desired.

original: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'dod pas 'gro ba'i rten no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'dod pas 'gro ba'i rten no //
translated: The support goes as desired.

original: yang na ji ltar grangs kyi dbye ba yis //
analyzed: yang na ji ltar grangs kyi dbye ba yis //
translated: Or, as the enumeration is divided.

original: zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: This occurs.

original: de'i phyogs la ni 'khor lo drug ni dbye bas zhes bya ba bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyogs la ni 'khor lo drug ni dbye bas zhes bya ba bshad par bya'o //
translated: In that case, the six wheels are explained as divided.

original: de ltar de'i rtsom pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar de'i rtsom pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the composition of the treatise,

original: da ni dngos su bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dngos su bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to explain the actual text,

original: de'i yan yag 'khor lo drug mdor bstan pa ni rtsibs drug po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so ;
analyzed: de'i yan yag 'khor lo drug mdor bstan pa ni rtsibs drug po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so ;
translated: the brief teaching on the six cakras of that is stated by “the six spokes” and so on.

original: / de'i dbyibs can gyi rlung gi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: / de'i dbyibs can gyi rlung gi 'khor lo'o //
translated: The cakra of wind has the shape of six spokes.

original: de las phyed ces bya ba ni rlung gi 'khor lo las phyed ni /
analyzed: de las phyed ces bya ba ni rlung gi 'khor lo las phyed ni /
translated: “ Half of that” is half of the wind cakra.

original: rtsibs gsum pa me'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: rtsibs gsum pa me'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: The fire cakra has three spokes.

original: de bzhin brgyad po brgyad ces bya ba ni brgyad po brgyad ni rtsa 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi'i dbyibs can ni sprul pa'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: de bzhin brgyad po brgyad ces bya ba ni brgyad po brgyad ni rtsa 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi'i dbyibs can ni sprul pa'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: “ The eight of the eight” are the eight of the shape of sixty-four channel petals, which is the emanation cakra.

original: de nas brgyad ces bya ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo ste rtsa brgyad kyi dbyibs can no //
analyzed: de nas brgyad ces bya ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo ste rtsa brgyad kyi dbyibs can no //
translated: “ Then the eight” is the dharmacakra, which has the shape of eight channels.

original: brgyad gnyis zhes bya ba ni 'dab ma bcu drug gi bdag nyid can longs spyod kyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: brgyad gnyis zhes bya ba ni 'dab ma bcu drug gi bdag nyid can longs spyod kyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: “ The two eights” is the enjoyment cakra, which has the nature of sixteen petals.

original: brgya phrag bzhi dang ni zhes bya ba ni rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can gyi bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: brgya phrag bzhi dang ni zhes bya ba ni rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can gyi bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: The four hundred is the great-bliss wheel, which has the nature of thirty-two channels.

original: grangs kyi sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo drug gi grangs kyi ngo po'o //
analyzed: grangs kyi sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo drug gi grangs kyi ngo po'o //
translated: The application of number is the essence of the number of the six wheels.

original: de ltar gsal zhes bya ba ni cho ga 'dir gsal ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar gsal zhes bya ba ni cho ga 'dir gsal ba'o //
translated: Thus clarity is clarity in this rite.

original: de ltar 'khor lo drug mdor bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'khor lo drug mdor bstan nas /
translated: Having thus summarized the six wheels,

original: da ni de rgyas par bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de rgyas par bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to explain them extensively,

original: de'i yan lag rlung gi 'khor lo rgyas par bshad pa ni /🔽zla ba phyed pa'i cha lta bu zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i yan lag rlung gi 'khor lo rgyas par bshad pa ni / zla ba phyed pa'i cha lta bu zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he explains the extensive explanation of the wind wheel, which is a branch of that.

original: zla ba phyed pa'i @204a * //
analyzed: zla ba phyed pa'i @204a * //
translated: The half-moon is said to be like the shape of a half-moon.

original: rnam pa'o // cha zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo la'o //
analyzed: rnam pa'o // cha zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo la'o //
translated: The part is the essence of the bodhicitta.

original: rlung gi 'khor lo zhes bya ba ni smin mtshams kyi dbus su gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rlung gi 'khor lo zhes bya ba ni smin mtshams kyi dbus su gnas pa'o //
translated: The wind wheel is located in the middle of the eyebrows.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: de'i phyir stong nyid ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir stong nyid ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said to be emptiness.

original: don dam par dngos po las rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par dngos po las rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because ultimately, there is no nature apart from things.

original: phyed pa'ang ma yin zhes bya ba ni lus la khyab pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: phyed pa'ang ma yin zhes bya ba ni lus la khyab pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it half, because it pervades the body.

original: rdzogs pa min zhes bya ba ni phyed pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzogs pa min zhes bya ba ni phyed pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it complete, because it is the nature of the half.

original: chu yi zla ba lta bur snang //
analyzed: chu yi zla ba lta bur snang //
translated: It appears like the moon in water.

original: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar chu'i nang du zla ba med pa rdzogs pa nyid dang bral ba de bzhin du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar chu'i nang du zla ba med pa rdzogs pa nyid dang bral ba de bzhin du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that just as the moon does not exist in the water, so it is devoid of completeness.

original: gzhan yang sgyu ma chen po zhes bya ba ni de lta bu nyid ma yin yang de ltar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang sgyu ma chen po zhes bya ba ni de lta bu nyid ma yin yang de ltar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it is called the great illusion because it appears as such, even though it is not so.

original: 'gro ba'i ma zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems nyid las ji ltar srid par 'gro ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i ma zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems nyid las ji ltar srid par 'gro ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the mother of the world, because the world is born from the very essence of the spirit of enlightenment, as is appropriate.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni lus la'o //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni lus la'o //
translated: Everything means in the body.

original: rten pa'i mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba ni rten pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: rten pa'i mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba ni rten pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The characteristic of support means the nature of support.

original: rlung gi 'khor lo zhes bya ba ni smin ma'i dbus su gtogs pa'i rtsibs drug pa la'o //
analyzed: rlung gi 'khor lo zhes bya ba ni smin ma'i dbus su gtogs pa'i rtsibs drug pa la'o //
translated: The so-called “wind wheel” is the six-spoked [wheel] located in the middle of the eyebrows.

original: srog ces bya ba ni srog gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: srog ces bya ba ni srog gi rang bzhin no //
translated: The so-called “life” is the nature of life.

original: ye shes can rnams kyi yang zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: ye shes can rnams kyi yang zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The “knowers” are those abiding in the stage of completion.

original: spyod yul min zhes bya ba ni spyod yul ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: spyod yul min zhes bya ba ni spyod yul ma yin pa'o //
translated: “Not an object” is not an object.

original: de ltar rlung gi 'khor lo rgyas par bshad pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rlung gi 'khor lo rgyas par bshad pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the extensive explanation of the wind wheel,

original: da ni me'i 'khor lo rgyas par bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni me'i 'khor lo rgyas par bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to explain the extensive explanation of the fire wheel,

original: me'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: me'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says, “The fire wheel,” etc.

original: longs spyod kyi 'khor lo'i 'og tu'o //
analyzed: longs spyod kyi 'khor lo'i 'og tu'o //
translated: It is below the enjoyment wheel.

original: stong nyid ces bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis khong stong du yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong nyid ces bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis khong stong du yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Emptiness” is the hollow nature.

original: nang du zhes bya ba ni dbus so //
analyzed: nang du zhes bya ba ni dbus so //
translated: “Inside” is the middle.

original: thig le'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni ham yig las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thig le'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni ham yig las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The “nature of the drop” is because it arises from the letter haṃ.

original: yi ge kun la zhes bya ba ni sngags thams cad la yi ge dang por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge kun la zhes bya ba ni sngags thams cad la yi ge dang por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All letters means that it is the first letter of all mantras.

original: kun du 'gro zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba chen po'i 'khor lo ma lus pa khyab par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du 'gro zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba chen po'i 'khor lo ma lus pa khyab par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Universal means that it pervades the entire wheel of the great elements.

original: kun du khyab ces bya ba ni dro bar gyur pa nyid kyis lus thams cad la khyab pa'o //
analyzed: kun du khyab ces bya ba ni dro bar gyur pa nyid kyis lus thams cad la khyab pa'o //
translated: Pervasive means that it pervades the entire body with heat.

original: rang 'byung zhes bya ba ni ma bcos pa'i ngo bos me yod pa'i phyir ro //🔽bde ba yang dag 'phel bar byed //
analyzed: rang 'byung zhes bya ba ni ma bcos pa'i ngo bos me yod pa'i phyir ro // bde ba yang dag 'phel bar byed //
translated: Self-arisen means that it exists as fire by its unfabricated nature.

original: ces bya ba ni bde ba chen po rnam pa gnyis 'phel par byed pa'o //🔽dbyangs dang gsal byed rnam par spangs //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni bde ba chen po rnam pa gnyis 'phel par byed pa'o // dbyangs dang gsal byed rnam par spangs //
translated: It increases bliss perfectly means that it increases the two types of great bliss.

original: zhes bya ba ni spros pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni spros pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Abandoning vowels and consonants means that it is free from conceptual elaborations.

original: 'jig rten gsum ni zhes bya ba ni mtho ris @204b dang mi yul dang sa 'og gi ming can gyi lus la'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum ni zhes bya ba ni mtho ris @204b dang mi yul dang sa 'og gi ming can gyi lus la'o //
translated: The three worlds means the bodies named heaven, human realm, and underworld.

original: ma lus pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor dang bcas pa rnams so //
analyzed: ma lus pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor dang bcas pa rnams so //
translated: Without exception means together with their retinues.

original: gcig tu byas zhes bya ba ni gtso bo'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: gcig tu byas zhes bya ba ni gtso bo'i rgyu'o //
translated: “Made one” is the primary cause.

original: skyed par byed ces bya ba ni de'i bdag po nyid kyis de las gzhan pa'i lus bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyed par byed ces bya ba ni de'i bdag po nyid kyis de las gzhan pa'i lus bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “ Produces” is because of generating another body from that by the power of that.

original: de ltar me'i 'khor lo rgyas par bshad pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar me'i 'khor lo rgyas par bshad pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the extensive explanation of the fire wheel,

original: da ni sprul pa'i 'khor lo rgyas par bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni sprul pa'i 'khor lo rgyas par bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to explain the extensive explanation of the emanation wheel,

original: mi shigs n'a da'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mi shigs n'a da'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares the indestructible nāda, and so on.

original: n'a da zhes bya ba ni aa yig gi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: n'a da zhes bya ba ni aa yig gi rnam pa ste /
translated: Nāda is the form of the letter A,

original: brag ca dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: brag ca dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is like an echo.

original: mi shig go 'phang zhes bya ba ni mi 'jig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mi shig go 'phang zhes bya ba ni mi 'jig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The “state of indestructibility” is because of indestructibility.

original: rnam pa thams cad rnam par spangs //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad rnam par spangs //
translated: “ Abandoning all aspects”

original: zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las dben pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las dben pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is because of being isolated from subject and object.

original: sbrul glog lce ltar g-yo ba'i lus //
analyzed: sbrul glog lce ltar g-yo ba'i lus //
translated: “ The body moves like a snake and lightning”

original: zhes bya ba ni glog dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni glog dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: is because of being like lightning.

original: tshangs pa la sogs zhes bya ba ni sku'i rdo rje la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa la sogs zhes bya ba ni sku'i rdo rje la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Brahma, etc. refers to those of Body-vajra, etc.

original: mes po dang shes bya ba ni skyed par byed pas so //
analyzed: mes po dang shes bya ba ni skyed par byed pas so //
translated: The grandfather refers to the creator.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: tshangs pa sku yi rdo rje 'gyur //
analyzed: tshangs pa sku yi rdo rje 'gyur //
translated: Brahma is the Body-vajra,

original: gsung gi rdo rje dbang phyug che //
analyzed: gsung gi rdo rje dbang phyug che //
translated: Maheśvara is the Speech-vajra,

original: thugs ni rdo rje 'dzin rgyal nyid //🔽de nyid khyab 'jug rdzu 'phrul che //
analyzed: thugs ni rdo rje 'dzin rgyal nyid // de nyid khyab 'jug rdzu 'phrul che //
translated: and the Mind-vajra is the King of the Vajra-holders.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: He himself is Viṣṇu, the Great Magician.

original: yi ge min zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i dbyibs dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge min zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i dbyibs dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Not a syllable means it is free from the shape of a syllable.

original: g-yo ba min zhes bya ba ni rtan pas mi 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yo ba min zhes bya ba ni rtan pas mi 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Not moving means it is not destroyed by being stable.

original: 'byung ba'i tshogs ni rnam par spangs //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i tshogs ni rnam par spangs //
translated: The aggregate of elements is abandoned.

original: zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'i khams yongs su spangs pa'i ngo bo ste gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'i khams yongs su spangs pa'i ngo bo ste gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This means it is the nature of the complete abandonment of the elements such as earth, because it is formless.

original: grangs med ces bya ba ni dbyangs dang gsal byed kyi grangs dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grangs med ces bya ba ni dbyangs dang gsal byed kyi grangs dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Not numbered means it is free from the number of vowels and consonants.

original: zad med ces bya ba ni 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zad med ces bya ba ni 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Not exhausted means it is indestructible.

original: skye ba med ces bya ba ni skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba med ces bya ba ni skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-arisen means that it is not arisen.

original: lte ba sprul pa'i 'khor lor gnas //
analyzed: lte ba sprul pa'i 'khor lor gnas //
translated: It abides in the navel, in the emanation wheel.

original: zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu lte ba'i gnas sprul pa'i 'khor lo'i dbus su gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu lte ba'i gnas sprul pa'i 'khor lo'i dbus su gnas pa'o //
translated: This means that it abides in the center of the emanation wheel in the navel region, in terms of the relative.

original: de ltar sprul pa'i 'khor lo rgyas par bshad pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar sprul pa'i 'khor lo rgyas par bshad pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus explained the emanation wheel in detail,

original: da ni chos kyi 'khor lo rgyas par bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni chos kyi 'khor lo rgyas par bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to explain the dharma wheel in detail,🔽it is said:

original: chos kyi 'khor lo'i dbus gnas pa //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo'i dbus gnas pa // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Abiding in the center of the dharma wheel,

original: h'um yig gi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: h'um yig gi rnam pa'o //
translated: it is the form of the syllable hūṃ.

original: sgra tsam zhes bya ba ni brag ca dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: sgra tsam zhes bya ba ni brag ca dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Sound alone means that it is like an echo.

original: dri ma dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //🔽cha bral zhes @205a * //
analyzed: dri ma dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro // cha bral zhes @205a * //
translated: Free from stains means that it is free from the stains of afflictions.🔽Partless means

original: bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that it is free from conceptuality.

original: rnam pa med pa dang zhes bya ba ni gnyis su snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa med pa dang zhes bya ba ni gnyis su snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Without aspect means that it is free from the appearance of duality.

original: dpe med ces bya ba ni bag chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe med ces bya ba ni bag chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The unimaginable is because of being free from latent tendencies.

original: gnas pa med pa zhes bya ba ni rten dang brten pa'i rnam par rtog ba nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa med pa zhes bya ba ni rten dang brten pa'i rnam par rtog ba nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The unabiding is because of the pacification of the conceptualization of the support and the supported.

original: g-yo med pa zhes bya ba ni byed pa po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yo med pa zhes bya ba ni byed pa po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The unwavering is because of the absence of an agent.

original: dpe las 'das zhes bya ba ni de dang 'dra ba gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //🔽srog dang rtsol ba rnam par spangs //
analyzed: dpe las 'das zhes bya ba ni de dang 'dra ba gzhan med pa'i phyir ro // srog dang rtsol ba rnam par spangs //
translated: The beyond analogy is because of the absence of another like it.

original: zhes bya ba ni rlung 'gags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rlung 'gags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The abandonment of life and exertion is because of the cessation of the winds.

original: ye shes mchog ces bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes mchog ces bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The supreme intuition is the aspect of natural luminosity.

original: lha'i dbang phyug ces bya ba ni lha rnams kyi bdag por gyur pa'i tshangs pa la sogs pa rnams la yang ngo //
analyzed: lha'i dbang phyug ces bya ba ni lha rnams kyi bdag por gyur pa'i tshangs pa la sogs pa rnams la yang ngo //
translated: The lord of gods is also Brahmā and so forth, who are the lords of the gods.

original: rnyed par dka' zhes bya ba ni rnyed par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: rnyed par dka' zhes bya ba ni rnyed par dka' ba'o //
translated: The difficult to attain is the difficult to attain.

original: de ltar chos kyi 'khor lo'i rgyas par bshad pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar chos kyi 'khor lo'i rgyas par bshad pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the extensive explanation of the wheel of dharma,🔽now, in order to teach the extensive explanation of the wheel of the vajra body, he says:

original: da ni longs spyod kyi 'khor lo rgyas par bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni longs spyod kyi 'khor lo rgyas par bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to explain the wheel of enjoyment in detail, it is said:🔽🔽

original: longs spyod ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: longs spyod ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to explain the enjoyment wheel in detail, [the Bhagavān] declares, “enjoyment,” and so on.

original: mchog tu zhes bya ba ni aom yig gi rnam pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: mchog tu zhes bya ba ni aom yig gi rnam pa nyid kyis so //
translated: “Supreme” means in the form of the letter O.

original: longs spyod 'khor lor gnas zhes bya ba ni mgrin pa'i dkyil 'khor du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod 'khor lor gnas zhes bya ba ni mgrin pa'i dkyil 'khor du gnas pa'o //
translated: “Abiding in the enjoyment wheel” means abiding in the throat maṇḍala.

original: rnam pa mchog ces bya ba ni spros pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa mchog ces bya ba ni spros pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Supreme aspect” means because of being free from elaborations.

original: 'chi ba med pa'i zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo las skyed par byed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chi ba med pa'i zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo las skyed par byed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Immortal” means because it is the cause of generating the essence of bodhicitta.

original: mchog tu zhes bya ba ni lus la'o //
analyzed: mchog tu zhes bya ba ni lus la'o //
translated: “Supreme” means in the body.

original: khongs su chud par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni khongs su chud par gyur pas nang du son par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: khongs su chud par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni khongs su chud par gyur pas nang du son par gyur pa'o //
translated: “Subsumed” means subsumed, having gone inside.

original: rnam pa kun gyi zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad du'o //
analyzed: rnam pa kun gyi zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad du'o //
translated: “In every way” means in every way.

original: yang dag bzhugs zhes bya ba ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag bzhugs zhes bya ba ni gnas pa'o //
translated: “Truly abiding” means dwelling.

original: rten cing 'brel 'byung rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel 'byung rang bzhin gyis //
translated: The nature of dependent origination

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen ni rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen ni rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: This is the cause and condition, by nature.

original: chang gi ro yis myos pa bzhin //
analyzed: chang gi ro yis myos pa bzhin //
translated: Like the taste of beer, it intoxicates.

original: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar chang gi ros myos pa khongs su gtogs pa de bzhin du zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽de ltar longs spyod kyi 'khor lo rgyas par bshad pa bstan nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar chang gi ros myos pa khongs su gtogs pa de bzhin du zhes bya ba'i don to // de ltar longs spyod kyi 'khor lo rgyas par bshad pa bstan nas /
translated: This is the meaning: just as the taste of beer intoxicates, so does this.🔽Having thus explained the cakra of enjoyment in detail,

original: da ni bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo rgyas par bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ni bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo rgyas par bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: now, in order to explain the cakra of great bliss in detail,

original: mchog gi dang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mchog gi dang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says the supreme first, etc.

original: ha yig de byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ha yig de byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The syllable ha is because of the nature of bodhicitta.

original: ma lus pa dngos po kun gyi zhes bya ba ni lus las 'byung @205b ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: ma lus pa dngos po kun gyi zhes bya ba ni lus las 'byung @205b ba rnams la'o //
translated: All things without exception means those that arise from the body.

original: nang na gnas zhes bya ba ni de nyid ni lus thams cad la khyab pas so //
analyzed: nang na gnas zhes bya ba ni de nyid ni lus thams cad la khyab pas so //
translated: Dwelling within means that it pervades the entire body.

original: mtshan nyid med ces bya ba ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyi yul ma yin pa nyid phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med ces bya ba ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyi yul ma yin pa nyid phyir ro //
translated: It is without characteristics means that it is not the domain of ordinary beings.

original: mtshan nyi 'das zhes bya ba ni ha yig gi rnam pa dang de nyid aa yig dang bral bas brjod par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyi 'das zhes bya ba ni ha yig gi rnam pa dang de nyid aa yig dang bral bas brjod par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The characteristic called “past” is the form of the letter ha, and because it is devoid of the letter a, it is expressible.

original: mtshan nyid thams cad rnam par spangs //
analyzed: mtshan nyid thams cad rnam par spangs //
translated: Devoid of all characteristics

original: zhes bya ba ni dbyangs dang gsal byed dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dbyangs dang gsal byed dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: means that it is devoid of vowels and consonants.

original: brjod du med ces bya ba ni de'i dbang gis 'byung ba'i lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba la ngag gi spyod yul las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod du med ces bya ba ni de'i dbang gis 'byung ba'i lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba la ngag gi spyod yul las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is inexpressible because the innate bliss that arises from it is beyond the domain of speech.

original: mi 'jig ces bya ba ni 'jig pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'jig ces bya ba ni 'jig pa med pa'o //
translated: It is indestructible because it is not destroyed.

original: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni gdod ma nas zhi ba nyid kyi phyir dang / rnam par rtog pa nye bar zhi ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni gdod ma nas zhi ba nyid kyi phyir dang / rnam par rtog pa nye bar zhi ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is peace because it is peace from the beginning and because discursive thought is pacified.

original: rang nyid nyams myong rang ngo bo //
analyzed: rang nyid nyams myong rang ngo bo //
translated: It is the experience of one’s own nature

original: zhes bya ba ni so so rang gi rig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni so so rang gi rig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: means that it is one’s own intuition.

original: rang gis nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o ;
analyzed: rang gis nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o ;
translated: That which has the nature of one’s own experience is so called.

original: / bde ba chen po 'khor lor gnas //
analyzed: / bde ba chen po 'khor lor gnas //
translated: Abides in the wheel of great bliss.

original: zhes bya ba ni mgo bo la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mgo bo la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is located in the head.

original: thob ces bya ba ni rtog par bya ba'o //
analyzed: thob ces bya ba ni rtog par bya ba'o //
translated: One should attain means one should imagine.

original: bla ma'i zhal zhes bya ba ni thos pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis rdo rje slob dpon gyi zhal las so //
analyzed: bla ma'i zhal zhes bya ba ni thos pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis rdo rje slob dpon gyi zhal las so //
translated: The guru's mouth means from the guru's mouth, by the power of hearing, reflection, and so forth.

original: de ltar don rnam pa ldas de rgyas par bshad pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar don rnam pa ldas de rgyas par bshad pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the extensive explanation by way of ten topics,

original: da ni de'i bde ba nye bar bsdu ba brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de'i bde ba nye bar bsdu ba brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to express the summary of its bliss,

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽sngar bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / sngar bstan pa rnams so //
translated: he says, thus, and so on.🔽The above-mentioned and so on refers to the six wheels.

original: ye shes che zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo drug nye bar mtshon pa sngon du 'gro bas ye shes chen po bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes che zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo drug nye bar mtshon pa sngon du 'gro bas ye shes chen po bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Great intuition means that it generates great intuition, preceded by the indication of the six wheels.

original: rang gi ngo bo rnam shes drug / ces bya ba ni me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i steng du de dmigs pa'i ye shes dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo rnam shes drug / ces bya ba ni me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i steng du de dmigs pa'i ye shes dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The six consciousnesses are its nature means that it is accompanied by the intuition that observes those five intuitions, such as the mirror-like intuition.

original: steng dang 'og tu sbyor zhes ba ni rang gu lus la steng dang 'og tu gnas pa'i dbyibs kyis so /
analyzed: steng dang 'og tu sbyor zhes ba ni rang gu lus la steng dang 'og tu gnas pa'i dbyibs kyis so /
translated: The above and below is in terms of the shape of the body, which is above and below.

original: rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni phan tshun du 'brel ba'i rnam pa can no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni phan tshun du 'brel ba'i rnam pa can no //
translated: The yoga is the form of mutual connection.

original: 'di rnams zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo drag pa lo'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo drag pa lo'o //
translated: The these is the six cakras.

original: rab tu grag pa la'o //
analyzed: rab tu grag pa la'o //
translated: The very is the very essence.

original: rab tug rtag zhes bya ba ni brjod pa'o //
analyzed: rab tug rtag zhes bya ba ni brjod pa'o //
translated: The always is the expression.

original: rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud dpal rdo rje phreng ba'i rgyal cher 'grel pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud dpal rdo rje phreng ba'i rgyal cher 'grel pa /
translated: The glorious Vajra Garland Great Yoga Tantra

original: pandi ta aa lam ka ka la shas mdzad pa /
analyzed: pandi ta aa lam ka ka la shas mdzad pa /
translated: is composed by the paṇḍita Alaṃkakalaśa.

original: zab mo'i don shin tu gsal bar byed ba zhes bya ba las /🔽le'u sum cu rtsa @206a * //
analyzed: zab mo'i don shin tu gsal bar byed ba zhes bya ba las / le'u sum cu rtsa @206a * //
translated: In the commentary called Illuminating the Profound Meaning,

original: brgyad pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
analyzed: brgyad pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
translated: the thirty-eighth chapter is explained.

original: // / de ltar le'u sum cu rtsa brgyad pas 'khor lo drug gi bsgom pa'i yul la dri ba'i lan bstan pa brjod nas //
analyzed: // / de ltar le'u sum cu rtsa brgyad pas 'khor lo drug gi bsgom pa'i yul la dri ba'i lan bstan pa brjod nas //
translated: Having explained the reply to the question about the object of meditation of the six cakras in the thirty-eighth chapter,

original: da ni dus kyi yul la dri ba'i lan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dus kyi yul la dri ba'i lan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to explain the reply to the question about the object of time,🔽it is said:

original: le'u sum cu rtsa dgu pa nye bar 'god cing /
analyzed: le'u sum cu rtsa dgu pa nye bar 'god cing /
translated: Chapter 39 is presented.

original: dang por re zhig de'i rtsom pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dang por re zhig de'i rtsom pa bstan pa ni /
translated: First, the composition is taught:

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Then, etc.

original: le'u sum cu rtsa brgyad pa bshad pa'i rjes la'o //
analyzed: le'u sum cu rtsa brgyad pa bshad pa'i rjes la'o //
translated: After explaining chapter 38.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du brjod pa'o //
translated: Also, etc. is as before.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rjes zhes bya ba ni drug pa rdo rje 'chang gi rnam pa de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rjes zhes bya ba ni drug pa rdo rje 'chang gi rnam pa de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One, Vajra, etc. is the Tathagata in the form of the sixth, Vajradhara.

original: dus kyi mtshan nyid sdom pa ni //
analyzed: dus kyi mtshan nyid sdom pa ni //
translated: The characteristics of time are summarized.
